results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.

I have heard it said ... that Shades of Fun is like Family... and Families celebrate Holidays ... So let's Gobble Gobble together...


Let's Give Thanks for all that we have and the new friends that we met through Shades Of Fun and let's do it in style at Milleridge Inn.  At The Milleridge Inn  offers exceptional cuisine to entice your culinary palette. Their menus change daily while still offering our Milleridge classic dishes like Milleridge Chicken, Sauerbraten,their ever popular Milleridge Popovers, Milleridge Quiche, their famous Cinnamon Bread and Turkey with all the trimmings. Let's dine and celebrate in historic old world charm. http://s390404975.onlinehome.us/menus /DINNER_MENU.pdf  (just an example)
 


After dinner we'll wander through a quaint village of specialty shops  echoing Long Islands beginnings including a full service bakery, florist, toy & gift shops. and enjoy the unique items available in each store. http://milleridge.com/the-shops-at-milleridge/

A little bit of History...http://milleridge.com/portfolio-type/milleridge-history/

A very special thank you to Maureen for enlightening me of this wonderful restaurant and village. In today's word it is very difficult to find an American cuisine restaurant

On meetups where a reservation is required we always inform you that "WE TAKE NO SHOWS AND LAST MINUTE CANCELLATIONS VERY SERIOUSLY". which means that you will no longer be able to attend certain events. Please if you have a "NS" next to your name do NOT RSVP "yes" for this event.

results.description:
Let's see the final installment of the Hunger Games: MockingJay Part II at the Alamo on SATURDAY November 21st - we'll go for the 5:30 showing, so we need to be there at 5pm to order dinner and drinks.  Please purchase your tickets in advance as it is reserved seating. My seating location is ROW 4, Seat 22. 

I have read all the books and seen each of the films -- eagerly awaiting the finale.. Here's a bit about the film: 

The stakes are no longer just for survival – they are for the future. With the nation of Panem in a full scale war, Katniss confronts President Snow in the final showdown. Katniss goes off on a mission with the unit from District 13 as they risk their lives to liberate the citizens of Panem, and stage an assassination attempt on President Snow who has become increasingly obsessed with destroying her. The mortal traps, enemies, and moral choices that await Katniss will challenge her more than any arena she faced in The Hunger Games. 

You can watch the trailer for this film - at this location: https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/show/the-hunger-games-mockingjay-part-2

Hope to see you there! 

May the odds be in your favor!!

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Ragtime by E.L. Doctorow

This work of historical fiction is mainly set in the New York City area from 1902 until 1912, with brief scenes towards the end describing the United States entry into World War Iin 1917. A unique adaptation of the historical narrative genre with a subversive 1970's slant, the novel blends fictional and historical figures into a framework that revolves around events, characters and ideas important in American history.

In 1998, the Modern Library ranked Ragtime number 86 on its list of the 100 best English-language novels of the 20th century. Time magazine included the novel in its TIME 100 Best English-Language Novels from 1923 to 2005.

About Location:

Taking inspiration from Southern charm and a downright adoration of premium browns, George Garrity presents Whiskey Social, where the fare hails from south of Mason-Dixon, the atmosphere is casual and the focus is on good hospitality. As in: The Whiskey Club, which includes private lockers for members to store their bottles alongside their own personalized, engraved gold plates. This is for the passion players. This is for us.

results.description:
11/21: 5:15-7:45pm; Those who didn't partake in Part 1 are more than welcome to join us this Saturday for what is bound to be a far-reaching and stimulating discussion! As the title suggests, please take a moment to view the note below to understand the healthy boundaries in place for Saturday's conversation.

Hello, hello! Earlier in the fall, our city and the world had a lot of religious-based activities with the Papal visit, Yom Kippur, Eid ul Adha, and more happening in one week. This I found interesting and gave rise to the thought of having this meetup relating religion (or a lackthereof) to Happiness.

We have many questions to explore and will keep an even-flow convo over the subject of how following religion, not following, and/or creating our own spiritual practice ties into our happiness levels. How do we direct our consciousness out to the world, what guides our actions and ultimately takes tolls on our happiness? Do we live life through a religious lens or lackthereof? Do we have spirit? Does a who/what enable each of our spirits to continue? We will explore these and hopefully many others provided time. To attend, please read below.


Note: by choosing to attend, you are agreeing to be respectful and sensitive to the believers and non-believers at the table (meaning no eye rolling, sighs, firm stances that indirectly insult, denigrating remarks, or passive aggressiveness whatsoever. We are all functional adults and will behave as one functional cohesive unit).

- As there likely be far opposites in this conversational theme, I will remind you that you are not attending to preach that God/Jesus loves all, to convince others that God does or doesn't exist, or to promote or push other dogmatic ideas and positions on others. You WILL be asked to leave otherwise. Nevertheless, we will have a stimulating and interesting conversation! All attending will be asked to share their life experience(s) in the religion arena and how they connect to happiness; we will also branch the conversation globally.

----

A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Kesebir-Diener_2008.pdf">In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Special Feature! Theism/Atheism/Agno­sticism & Happiness, II (Read Note)

results.name: Special Feature! Theism/Atheism/Agno­sticism & Happiness, II (Read Note)

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 36-48. SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

results.description:
Dear Group Members,

After a great summer and a small break from our monthly series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’, I am very happy and honor to announce that our second edition of The Flame Festival is coming out next NOVEMBER 20TH – 22ND, 6pm- 7:30pm at Cornelia Street Café showcasing the unique work of some of the musicians whom has been part of our series. I want to take the time as well to thank you all for supporting the series by coming to our performances.

On Saturday NOVEMBER 21st, the festival will showcase the original compositional style of the great Minneapolis guitar player Juanito Pascual.

November 21st
6pm – 7.30pm. Not to be missed!!!
$15 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nvJez5VWmXg

About Juanito Pascual

Juanito nació en Minneapolis y es reconocido tanto en España como en los Estados Unidos por su creatividad y único estilo musical al tocar la guitarra. Juanito se ha presentado en los mejores festivales y clubs de los Estados Unidos. Su último álbum se titula “Juanito Pascual New  Flamenco Trio” que crea sonidos fusionados con el flamenco, jazz, música del mundo y en ocasiones influencias del rock y soul. Este trabajo fue grabado por el ganador de diferentes Grammy Rob Griffin.

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ with Juanito Pascual

Flamenco Trio” que crea sonidos fusionados con el flamenco, jazz, música del mundo y en ocasiones influencias del rock y soul. Este trabajo fue grabado por el ganador de diferentes Grammy Rob Griffin.

https://youtu.be/nvJez5VWmXg

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ with Juanito Pascual

results.description: "I'm gonna dance," Nomi Malone (Elizabeth Berkley) insists in the opening scene of Showgirls, and dance she does. In this quasi-update of All About Eve, Nomi is a drifter whose sole ambition is to headline the "Goddess" topless dance show at the Stardust in Las Vegas. Of course, even Nomi must pay her dues, and she does so at the Cheetah, grinding poles and lap dancing her way to a future. Fortunately, her roommate, Molly, works at the Stardust and invites Nomi to see the show, where she meets Crystal Conners (Gina Gershon, in the Bette Davis role), with whom she immediately forms a love/hate relationship. Nomi soon learns what she must do to get ahead, and the rest of the film documents her cat-like crawl up the showgirl ladder of success. Directed by Paul Verhoeven, (Robocop, Basic Instinct, The Fourth Man), Showgirls was conceived as the first big-budget "adult" film since 1977's Caligula, and the first such production to wear the NC-17 rating; its failure at the box-office discouraged further attempts at large-scale adult productions.

results.description:
ABRN calling All Entrepreneurs and people in business.
Are you curious about getting your business to thrive and with more ease?
This will be the premier business referral network.
Our members are entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and those starting businesses, who want to network and collaborate with others, and also learn tools to grow their businesses.

What is ABRN?

A small number of ABRN members 30-50 Entrepreneurs, (likely to add new groups from different neighborhoods) who will interact and promote new members businesses in monthly meetings. What makes these groups unique is they only have one Entrepreneur representing a line of product or service. As a member of these groups, you will get to network with other professionals on a monthly basis where you will get to know them and their business or service personally. In each meeting, members can self-introduce, promote their products and services. Your products or services may not be something most ABRN members need or are looking for, but getting to know you, builds trust and friendships. As they run across people who are looking for what you offer, they will refer your products or services to those in need. ABRN promote professionals through word of mouth referral that enables them to develop long term business networks.

FREE NETWORKING EVENTS

ABRN offers free events to its general membership from time to time. There is a chance to mingle with other professionals and exchange information’s. A great networking tool!

A: - ABRN welcomes your suggestions and leadership

B: - Bring lots of business cards. Not only will you be giving your cards to those at your table and others you meet during the event, we also have a card table with cards for everyone attending, so you can select those that interest you or that you think would be a service or product you could recommend to someone you know. The cards are placed in categories. Your business may be applicable to multiple categories so be sure to bring enough. You can take your unused cards with you at the end of the event.

C: - 2- Next be prepared to give a one minute presentation (Promote Yourself®). The best structure to use is this. Your name, your business and location. How long you have been in business. What is your product or service? This event should be about building relationships and getting lots of future referrals, NOT making a quick one time sale. Let your personality come through the presentation.

D: - 3- Network, Free Network, Free Network! Remember, this event is not about making a sale, so relax!! Just be yourself and get to know others with the intent of working together and supporting our local colleagues by referring them to your friends and customers when they are looking for that service. They will be doing the same for you!

E:- Attend an ABRN meeting! Remember, the ABRN does not make any money from these events, so this is not a sales pitch. The absolute best way to get referrals is from someone who is familiar with you! The more your companies name and product is heard, the faster it will come to mind when someone says they are looking for what you do. Building an identity to your company is priceless.

F:- Make referrals!!! Get Business!!!! Professional Word of Mouth!!!!

G:- Join ABRN today and start getting Business Referrals and Business Connections.

  ABRN= Start, run and grow your business.
results.name: ABRN Dinner Meeting

FORTICKETS GO TO www.SwingRemix.com


SWING REMIX


SATURDAY NOVEMBER 21, 2015


Featuring Ron Sunshine & His Orchestra


DJ John Festa!

LATEST NEWS: Ron Sunshine's NEW CD release will be NOV 21st at the Swing Remix Dance Spectacular. Ron will have hard copies of the CD Bring It Home and some additional merchandise for purchase.

PRE-DANCE WORKSHOPS

SLOW DANCING Swing WORKSHOP (All Levels)


When the tempo gets slow, it can be difficult to use your swing steps and moves. This class will teach alternative steps, as well as strategies for pacing the standards, and it will give you a chance to practice leading and following. Students should already be familiar with triple-steps and basic, six-count swing moves.


Instructor: Nathan Bugh & Gaby Cook

FAST DANCING specialty WORKSHOP (Intermediate Level)


When the tempo gets hot, learn how to play it cool — Nathan and Gaby share their tricks for cutting a rug. Improve your efficiency, and make faster tempos easy, by understanding footwork choices, move choices, and the flow of momentum. Relax and enjoy fast songs. Students should already be comfortable with 6-count and 8-count swing moves, and charleston basics.


Instructor: Nathan Bugh & Gaby Cook

Nathan & Gaby dancers

DANCE TIMELINE


7:30 General Admission Doors Open


7:45 BEGINNER Dance Lesson (FREE with dance admission)


8:30 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


10:45 Dance Performances featuring:


Gaby Galore & Her Sugar Shakers

11:00 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


1:00AM END


All Ages

Tickets: $16 early bird (before NOV 19) / $18 Door


*specialty dance workshops extra

O Brasil Series is presented in collaboration with Cinema Tropical, and organized by guest curator Marcela Goglio. 

One of the main features of Brazil’s impressive recent output of quality cinema is its variety—of genres, voices and styles. Government funding has allowed filmmakers an unprecedented creative freedom, which has resulted in a large share of the market for local movies.

AUSÊNCIA

A festival favorite (including Best Actor and Special Jury Prize winner at the Rio Film Festival), Chico Teixeira's new feature is a refreshingly honest and touching coming-of-age story about the charismatic 15-year old Serginho. He tackles familial and sexual unrest, and the pressure of social expectations, as he seeks love and the freedom to pursue his dreams.


Dir. Chico Teixeira. 2015, 88 mins. DCP. New York premiere.


Tickets: $12. Members of the NY Brazilian Portuguese meetup group get a 20% discount at check out. Use the code NYBrazilMeetup to receive it. Click here to purchase yours.

Enjoy the movie,

Aparecida Teixeira

results.description:
GrassROOTS Community Foundation presents the 4th Annual Give Thanks Cocktail Fundraiser & Tribute hosted by Board Member Mona Scott Young @ Montclair Museum.

"Join us on November 21st for our annual Cocktail Fundraiser and Tribute at the Montclair Art Museum. Features music by Kindred The Family Soul. We will also honor two amazing women who have survived cancer and continue to dedicate their lives to serving the community." Tickets are on sale now at: GiveThanksTribute.Eventbrite.Com

Ticket price: $100

In the spirit of Tanji Dewberry, GrassROOTS honors its’ Wellness Warriors. Tanji was a GCF partner who suffered from a severe mental health challenge. At times she experienced great success and others she succumbed to the pain. Sadly we lost Tanji and her son to a house fire in 2013. We celebrate her warrior spirit by honoring three women, who despite facing personal challenges, have met their obstacles as opportunities. Funds raised from this event go to support the Georgia King Housing Development in Newark, NJ. For the past four years, GrassROOTS give thanks by providing needy residents with a 20lbs turkey and a 5lbs bag of fruit and vegetables.

Our goal is to raise $30,000 in support of GrassROOTS’ wellness programs for residents of Georgia King Village and throughout New Jersey.

MYX & Mingle cocktail hour with music by Enoch Smith Jr. Jazz Band from 7-8pm.

Tribute to the late GrassROOTS supporter Tanji Dewberry and two Wellness Warriors: Kym Gilchrist and Sonia Fergus, cancer survivors

Music by Kindred The Family Soul and DJ Scotty Nevers

grassrootscommunityfoundation.org/events/event/2015-grassroots-give-thanks-cocktail-fundraiser/

results.description:
Us And Floyd is a Long Island, New York based Pink Floyd tribute band. Us and Floyd strives to perform accurate recreations of the timeless music of Pink Floyd. These professional musicians have grown up as avid Floyd fans and incorporate their knowledge of the band and it's history into every live show. Their collective appreciation for Floyd is evidenced by the passion and precision of their performances.

The band covers songs from the vast catalog of albums including: Atom Heart Mother, Meddle, Dark Side of The Moon, Wish You Were Here, Animals, The Wall and The Final Cut.

There are limited opportunities to catch this music performed live. So join Us And Floyd as we honor the works of the greatest progressive rock act of all time; Pink Floyd!

results.description:
West Coast Swing is a contemporary form of swing dancing that's becoming very popular & can be danced to any kind of music! Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.

Join us to mix, mingle and learn West Coast Swing dancing from a professional dance instructor.

Get your ticket here -
http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/t/so1121/

https://youtu.be/s86FMNfPgQ0

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
UPDATE!!!!

I pushed it back to 7:30. Slava ("Rostislav Persion") is already there, he's the guy with the beard. The reservation is under "Edwin"

If anybody needs to text me, my number is[masked]

I need to go pick up Hanneh, which I MIGHT do at this point, but the thing is we'd need to stop by her place so she can put boots on.

I've been wanting to do a campfire night for a long time, and thought I'd try to fit it in before Thanksgiving, after which it's apparently to cold for people to brave. The little fire circle at the Closter Nature Center is the only fire pit I know of locally that isn't barred from being used; apparently it's a huge liability and the insurance is expensive and even the boy scouts barely do camp fires anymore, so it's lucky that the one place left is so close by.

We'll start by eating dinner at Brady's Fox Hunt Inn, which I have not yet been to but I hear is very good.

Later we will head down the road to Closter to the Closter Nature Center for the campfire.

I will be asking for $14 from everyone. Mark (runs the Closter Nature Center) said the event cost at the CNC is $75, so I figure $9 per person as a donation would end up covering it. Obviously, the more people show, the smaller the split would be, but I encourage everyone that we try to leave more for Mark than the bare minimum of $75. The other $4 will go to firewood and material, and the last $1 to the meetup group. I can make receipts so you can write it off as a donation at tax time, though I guess only for the $9 going to the Closter Nature Center.

The Nature Center is located at 154 Ruckman Road, Closter, NJ. There is some parking right there. If that parking lot gets full, there is parking across the pond, behind the other log cabin. To get to that parking space, you turn onto Irving Ave from Piermont Road, drive to the dead end of Irving where it's gravel road, and make a right. The turn onto Irving is right across the street from the driveway exit of Sear steakhouse. If we need even more parking, that dead end of Irving, and some of Ruckman Road can also serve as parking. Ruckman Road is a main road with limited shoulder space, but when the Nature Center's held events, I've seen people park there. Any such parking is at your own risk.

The campfire is located at:
Once you enter the main entrance to the Nature Center (Ruckman Road), and park at that parking space, if you look across the pond, sort of along the direction of Ruckman road, the campfire is on that other side. There is a path circling the entire pond so you can get there. The parking on that other side of the pond, behind the other log cabin, that you get to from Irving ave, is much closer to the campfire, and I'm going to be parking there.

Now, I had a whole picture thingy made up, but I'm not sure if I can post pics or edit a meetup later once I've posted in this group, so I'll just link to an old meetup where walking directions with pictures are provided.

http://www.meetup.com/Tri-State-20-30-Somethings/events/219686954/

I don't know how to change the max RSVP on this group either, otherwise I would, because we don't want like 20 people trying to fit around a campfire.
results.name: Campfire Night

Join us Saturday night for a bar crawl in Forest Hills. Our starting point will be the Station House which offers a wide variety of craft beers. The bar typically gets packed so we'll have a drink or so and continue on to other spots in the in the neighborhood. Possible destinations include - Jade, Dirty Pierre, the Irish Cottage, Tap House and more.

Don't worry Astorians, you can get to the neighborhood by taking the M or R train to Forest Hills, 71st Ave.


To find us along the way, my contact # is [masked]

results.description:
Us And Floyd is a Long Island, New York based Pink Floyd tribute band. Us and Floyd strives to perform accurate recreations of the timeless music of Pink Floyd. These professional musicians have grown up as avid Floyd fans and incorporate their knowledge of the band and it's history into every live show. Their collective appreciation for Floyd is evidenced by the passion and precision of their performances.

The band covers songs from the vast catalog of albums including: Atom Heart Mother, Meddle, Dark Side of The Moon, Wish You Were Here, Animals, The Wall and The Final Cut.

There are limited opportunities to catch this music performed live. So join Us And Floyd as we honor the works of the greatest progressive rock act of all time; Pink Floyd!
results.how_to_find_us: Will try and sit on right side of stage across from the bar near the stage.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
Konnichiwa,

The November J-Meetup will be Japanese-English Speed Dating!

The purpose of this event is not limited to find your dates, but also to seek your language exchange partners and new friends. Therefore, you don't have to be single to participate. If you are already married or have a partner, use this opportunity to practice your target language (Japanese or English)

By participating, the members will have the opportunity to introduce themselves each other in Japanese. However, if you are an ESL student who wants to improve your English communication skills or prefer to talk in English, please feel free to do so.


Time: 8pm - 10:30pm (Speed Dating will begin at 8:30pm and end at 9:30pm)
Cost: $5 - @ Door

Basic "jikoshoukai" (Introducing yourself)

1. Konnichiwa / Konbanwa! (hi/good evening)

2. Watashi wa / Watashi no namae wa your name desu.  (namae = name)

ex. Watashi wa Yoijoho desu. (I am Yoijoho)


3. Watashi wa your country jin desu.   e.g. America jin = American person

ex. Watashi wa Nihon jin desu. (I am Japanese)

4. Watashi wa dokushin desu. (I am single)


5. Douzo yoroshiku onegai shimasu. (Nice to meet you)

Rule of the Game

The participants will sit in pairs to begin their first 8 minute date to discuss anything they want in Japanese or in English.

After 8 minutes, you will hear a whistle, and one of each pair move on to meet their next date.

Following each date, the participants will note in their cell phone whether they would have an interest in talking to their date again.


After completing the speed dating game, the participants will go look for the person whom they are interested in speaking again. If a mutual interest is noted, each party will exchange phone numbers.

Looking forward to the many participants!

Yoijoho
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the private room in the back.
results.name: The NYC Japanese Language November Meetup - Japanese-English Speed Dating!

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson with Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes pre-party class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 7 then 'CALL' on the intercom*

results.description:
We have received the Permit for the off weeks of before - Guaranteed Game this week.

Same Rules Apply

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) Keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot. No-Shows will be banned from the group.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

results.description:
FALL IS REALLY HERE  AND THE HOLIDAYS ARE JUST AROUND THE CORNER! WHY NOT  TREAT YOURSELF TO SOME  FUN AND EXCITEMENT AND MEET PEOPLE  FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING. 

ENJOY A GREAT EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT OUR FALL FLING AT ONE OF OUR FAVORITE VENUES, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT! 

TELL A FRIEND * BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING RIGHT IN FRONT. PLEASE USE THE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE RIGHT.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.


DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

ENJOY A GREAT EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT OUR FALL FLING AT ONE OF OUR FAVORITE VENUES, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT! 

TELL A FRIEND * BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING RIGHT IN FRONT. PLEASE USE THE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE RIGHT.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.


DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE AND TRY TO HAVE EXACT CHANGE AT THE DOOR, THANK YOU!

venue.name: Ethical Brew at The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert:

Gathering Time with special guest: Ron Renninger

Tkts & More Information : www.EthicalBrew.org 

The partnered charity for this concert is Strengthen Our Sisters  they provide safe housing and supportive services for hundreds of families who are victims of domestic violence and homelessness

Gathering Time

 Comprised of Hillary Foxsong, Stuart Markus and Gerry McKeveny, Gathering Time is like a high energy Peter, Paul & Mary or a co-ed Crosby, Stills & Nash with various parts of The Byrds, Joni Mitchell, the Eagles and America; a head-turning folk trio described as "getting a whole beehive-full of buzz" on the northeast regional folk scene.

Gathering Time's 2007 remake of Peter Yarrow's "Light One Candle" has been spun on stations ranging from NYC's top-rated WCBS-FM to Israel's Galilee plains; their 2008 CD "Songs of Hope and Freedom" won wide acceptance on folk stations nationwide. In 2012, the trio's second CD "Red Apples and Gold," rose to #5 on the Folk DJ charts in September and to #12 on the national Roots Music Report radio charts in October, charting at #76 in the year-end Top 100 Albums. Their third CD "When One Door Closes..." reached #3 on the Folk DJ charts in January 2014.

Gathering Time was voted "best band" runner-up as well as "top folk band" in the 2011 Long Island Press readers' poll.

The trio's fourth CD, "Keepsake," will see release in the fall of 2015.

Here's what the critics are saying about Gathering Time...

"Among the finest performers in the New York metropolitan area, whatever the size of the venue, from a house concert to an outdoor festival," with "harmonies that can charm the birds out of the trees, strong original songs, and a savvy repertoire of cover songs, ranging from traditional folk to classic rock. They appeal to audiences of all ages."

JOHN PLATT, WFUV

"I have to say that Gathering Time is right up there with the ones we all know -- they are the next generation of great trios with meaningful music performed in awesome harmony."

BILL HAHN, WFDU 89.1FM

For Gather Time's website: www.gathering-time.com

https://youtu.be/1osrCHNJpMg


Ron Renninger

About Ron Renninger

Self-taught at age 15, Ron Renninger has enjoyed a notable career as a singer/songwriter, studio musician and recording artist. He has shared the stage with folk royalty Richie Havens, Lucinda Williams, Jessie Colin Young, John Hammond Jr., Lucy Kaplansky, Sonny Terry and Brownie McGhee. Ron has performed at such well-known venues as Gerdes Folk City, Telluride Bluegrass Festival, The Bottom Line and numerous other U.S. and international venues. A sought-after studio musician, he is currently working on his own soon to be released 6th CD, "Late Bloomer." Aided by outstanding dexterity on an old Martin, and a slightly raspy baritone, Ron's music touches on universal themes that can at once entertain, inspire and often move some feet.


Here's the buzz on Ron Renninger ...

"Ron Renninger more than held his own with well crafted, well sung and superbly played original compositions. An unexpected treat."

THE NEW YORK TIMES

"Simple instrumentation keeps his voice and nimble finger picking in the forefront. Renninger seems to be an artist whose fuse and muse still burn bright."

PERFORMING SONGWRITER Magazine

"He truly is a great Singer, Songwriter and Guitarist. Ron's music seems somehow to tap into the sub conscience; he's able to put into words those thoughts and feelings that usually lie just below the surface".

CHRISTINE LAVIN

For Ron's website: www.ronrenninger.com


https://youtu.be/hcbL3XvH8Pk

results.description:
Lets go back to Eleanor Rigby's to see the Generators.... 

Eleanor Rigby's a Classic Friendly Pub....as we know with really good food...

Atmosphere Reminiscent of Cheers ....where everyone knows your name "  .....we are glad to return to a classic Long Island favorite

Reservations ....Let me know if you would like to join us for dinner or meet us for good conversation and dancing after 9.....  We have the big table in the fireplace room....

Been hearing great things about this band..... they have become a main house draw at Eleanor's and Ottos on the Mile...
   A four piece cover band featuring Manny Campos on Guitar/Vocals, Robin Campos on       Drums/Vocals, Nelson Arce on Bass/vocals, and John Pagliarulo on Keyboard/Vocals.
We play a HUGE variety of music ranging from the Classic rock from Motown to Today ....  Robin on Drums holds the beat ....  Long history of learning their licks and chops all the way back to days of Grumman Long island and the scene back in the Eighties

No Cover Charge .....
results.name: Dinner ....Mingle n Dancing with the Generators @ Eleanor Rigbys

results.description:
This is the first Meetup I ever did years ago and still everyone's favorite! And with Culture Club closed, this party has become more popular than ever!  So back by popular demand we're taking you back, WAY back to the original...

Drink Specials & Snacks -

• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• FREE Shot for all this month's birthdays

• FREE Snacks for everybody

Music, Prizes & Giveaways -

• DJ  (@akadlj) spins best of 80s & 90s party music

• VJ (@stephenpitalo) plays the greatest 80s & 90s videos 

• 80s & 90s themed Prizes & Giveaways

Icebreakers - 

• You will get slip of paper with an 80s or 90s song/artist

• Find person with matching song/artist & each get a FREE shot

Admission - 

• $10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "8090" at checkout 

• Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/809015/dates/Nov-21-2015_at_0830PM

• $15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o  

Is this private? Yes, the entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests.

How should I dress? Neat casual. No sweats, hats, etc. Jeans ok.

Is this age specific? This event is not meant to be gender/age/religion specific. 21+

Can I come alone? Yes, most will come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 200+ members attending!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’re excited to announce the release of our Free Quiet Clubbing App 2.0

Hosted at Stage 48 a massive night club, 3x as larger as our first app release party, this one will have you dancing, singing and drinking all night long.

Steps for getting 50% off the tickets:
1) Download or upgrade to v2.0 (Click link from phone)
2) Click “Free Tix”
3) Share with a friend & you’ll also get a 50% coupon code in your email

There Will Be 3 Dj’s Spinning Live!
Green DJ– EDM/Dance/House
Red DJ– 90s/2K/Top40
Blue DJ– Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: 50% OFF App 2.0 Quiet Clubbing Launch Party!

results.description:
BACHATA Night!

DJs: Brian "EL MATATAN", Young Maestra and Milton "EL TOLETE"

@ 10pm Milton "EL TOLETE" teaching the basics and Logistics of BACHATA.

What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

Have a Birthday Coming up! Contact us to do your Bday Party.


More information: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/663744417058409/

Friends,

Join us for our Saturday Night Social Mixer@ Slate NYC. We always have a fun time at that venue.

The group will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from our other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

This event is for members in their 20's & 30's.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Hangout and Meetup at 10 in front of the bar

Seating and Show starts in the backroom at 10:30

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!

Inner Engineering is a method, a tool to engineer a deep and lasting personal transformation. It is a combination of methods and technologies derived from the ancient science of yoga. It is a comprehensive system addressing every aspect of human well-being – from body, mind and emotion to the fundamental life energy within us.

Over two million people have completed the “Inner Engineering” program worldwide and have reported remarkable results. The program includes engaging discourses exploring the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life situations, along with guided meditations, group discussions, simple yoga postures, and a powerful and purifying energy technique designed to bring one’s entire system into alignment and harmony.

Shambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony. Benefits:

• Relief from chronic ailments 

• Improved mental clarity, sleep quality, and increased energy levels

• Ability to handle stressful situations effortlessly 

• Deepening of interpersonal relationships, thus cultivating a greater sense of connectivity at home, work and in the community

• Helps to purify the five elements (earth, water, fire, air, space) in the body leading to pleasantness in the body, mind and emotion 

• Access to the intelligence and competence within, which is the very source of creation 

• Greater peace and joy in everyday life.

Casual and comfortable clothing.

THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. Plus we'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give you a $50 Off, coupon for your "Student Package"

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now! (Get back a $25 coupon for Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. YTou can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

If you have one, bring a copy of your coupon with you

Become a Premium Member Learn more...

results.description:
Hello Everybody,,,, I'm back !     And I would like you all to join me for a walk down the Henry Hudson Trail,,,, We haven't done this one in a long time. And I know how much you all love it. This is a great walk for all you New Peeps to join us on. You'll make new friends, get some exercise, and have a wonderful time to boot ! 


• At 8:45am We will Meet in the Big Commuter Parking Lot on The Left that you pass on the way to Sissy's...


This is always a fun walk for all the Newbies to come out and get acquainted with everyone.  This walk has some spectacular views.

Believe it or not there is a little Park off to the side of the trail. Some even call it the "Secret Garden". We can take a quick peek at it if you wish... It only takes a couple of minutes to do it.

We will be walking in an Easterly Direction till we hit the end of the trail at Highlands. Then we'll take a break for a few minutes.... maybe talk about the Great Breakfast we all want to have.  Then we will head on back to our starting point. From there, for those who want to join us for coffee & a bite to eat. We'll probably go to Sissy's, Which BTW is Very Good, and takes good care of us.

Sneakers may be worn, but You might want to wear Hiking Boots/Shoes for walking on this trail,,,

And.....As always, we will walk in a LIGHT RAIN and Sunshine

Please Remember to Dress for the Weather ! 

• Please Only bring Two-Legged Friends. ! Thank you for understanding. 

• See you all @ 9:00am. And please arrive 10 minutes early so we get started at 9am !

Only A Heavy Rain will Cancel this walk and it will be posted on this page. Those who signed on will be notified By E-mail. If in doubt, check it out. 

CANCELLATIONS Rarely Ever Happen !
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the commuter parking lot on the left, where the Henry Hudson Trail crosses First Ave - before getting to Sissy's.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
LEADER: Pete Heckler ([masked] (preferred) or[masked])

RATING: B 5 B

Meet  9AM at  Skyline Diner (Rt 511), Ringwood Ave, Ringwood NJ (Passaic, Co. )  From Boy Scout Camp we will travel on the Wyanokie Circular, Outlaw, Wyanokie Crest, and Highlands  Trails. This is a Dan Chazin recommended hike. You must register for this hike. Rain /hazardous conditions cancel. TC North Jersey Trails map 115.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
