results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME INTERMEDIATE SINGLETRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING AT WALNUT MOUNTAIN PARK IN LIBERTY, NY.

Please arrive by 10:30am at the William E. Pearson Entrance Parking Area to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 10:45am.

PARK DESCRIPTION:

Walnut Mountain Park is located in Liberty, New York and consists of 265 acres. Walnut Mountain is the second highest mountain in Sullivan County. The Park can be accessed from either the William E. Pearson entrance at the end of Walnut Mountain Road (off Route 55, west of the village) or the Lake Street entrance (intersection of West Lake Street and Eagle Drive). This Park was formally the property of the Walnut Mountain Hotel, which was located at the top face of the mountain. Foundations and the hotels fireplace can still be seen along the walking trails. The land was purchased by the Town of Liberty in the 1960’s and has been developed into a park. There are approximately 13 miles of Hiking and Mountain Biking Trails winding throughout the park which are considered some of the best in the area. Much of the terrain is steep which allows for a wonderful experience for the advanced mountain bikers, but yet, gradual enough grades for the less experienced bikers and hikers. The views throughout the park are breathtaking.


DIRECTIONS TO PARK:

William E. Pearson Entrance (73 Walnut Mountain Rd.Liberty, NY 12754)

From Route 17 Heading North:

Take Exit 100 A. Turn left on Route 55W. Go to traffic roundabout and follow Route 55Wtowards Main Street. Make a left at first light onto Lake Street/55W. Veer left at the Y at top of hill onto Route 55W. Go approximately ¼ of a mile and turn right onto Walnut Mountain Road. Follow to the park entrance.

From Route 17 Heading South:

Take Exit 99. Take left onto North Main Street. Take right at second light onto Lake Street/55W. Veer left at the Y at top of hill onto Route 55W. Go approximately a ¼ mile and turn right onto Walnut Mountain Road. Follow to the park entrance.

From Route 52 Heading East:

Take Right onto Ferndale Loomis Road. At four-way intersection take a left onto Route 55E. Go approximately one mile and turn left onto Walnut Mountain Road. Follow to the park entrance.

Distance: approx 13 miles


Estimated Bike Time: 2-3 hours

Difficulty: Advanced Beginner/Intermediate - rolling hills and climbs with rocks, roots, gravel and leaves


Current Weather Forecast: Partly Sunny with a high of 44 degrees


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Bug Spray, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

WHERE TO MEET?

William E. Pearson Entrance Parking Area

RELATED MAPS:

http://www.townofliberty.org/walnut_park.pdf

MORE INFO:

http://www.townofliberty.org/walnut.htm

results.description:
Rockland Lake – Hook Mt. We will meet at 10:45 AM and start hiking at 11:00 AM

Meeting location is just east of the Rockland Lake Fire House on Landing Road northeast of the Rockland Lake State Park. Driving directions: assuming you are starting in Nyack, NY, take Route 9W north about 4 miles and turn right into the SECOND entrance to the park. That’s the north entrance, which is past the south entrance. Follow the entrance road to the left and go up the hill to a “T” in the road – take the left onto Landing Road and drive past the fire house, where we will be waiting.

The hike stars along the Long Trail at historic ruins associated with the Rockland Lake ice industries and former village, then climbs a moderately steep to the top of the palisades ridge with wonderful views of the Hudson River to the east and Rockland Lake to the west. We lunch just north of Hook Mt. and eventually work our way down to Nyack Beach State Park and follow the river path back to our start. Total length is about 6 to 7 miles.

There will be an after-hike party at the Bassell’s in West Nyack for club members and prospective members. Send an email to Carlene if you plan on attending the party, so we have a sense of how much food to prepare.
results.name: Hike Hook Mountain

results.description:
Join us for a full Sunday of social Wikipedia editing at Center for Jewish History (drop-in any time!), during which we will create, update, and improve Wikipedia articles pertaining to the American Soviet Jewry movement.

All are invited, with no specialized knowledge of the subject or Wikipedia editing experience required.


We encourage participants to take advantage of resources from the Archive of the American Soviet Jewry Movement at the American Jewish Historical Society that were recently digitized with the generous support of the National Historical Publications & Records Commission (NHPRC). 

Training sessions on editing Wikipedia will be held at 11:15 am and 1:00 pm. Experienced Wikipedians will be on-hand to assist throughout the day.. Please bring your laptop and power cord; we will have library resources, WiFi, and a list of suggested topics on hand.


Light refreshments will be provided.

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/publiclands.jpg?itok=E35GtadA Leader Curt Collier

Dan Hanson presides 

America was the first country to create national parks and continues to expand protection each year.  Seemingly at odds with our other legacy of Manifest Destiny, displacement and land grabbing by private individuals Americans seem to have a passion for preservation.  What are the roots of this phenomenon, is it changing and how can we use these sentiments in the service of further environmental protections including our air, soil, water and lands beyond our borders.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
The inexplicable joy of not knowing!

What is the mysterious paradox of the Sanskrit word Chitta. Which can barely be translated into English but, means something like, 'the harmonious tension between the knowable and the unknowable'.   This week we will talk about how a dialectical approach is at the base of the funnest and most effective solutions to life. 

I look forward to seeing everyone this Sunday at 11am.

Don't forget to bring something inspirational to share: a personal anecdote, a song, a photo....

See you soon!

Ne estu schmukie:)

results.description:
More of What's in a Character?

This is the second workshop that will focus on character work. (You do not have to take the first one to take this one.) 

You will learn techniques that will enable you to discover the voice, body, emotional life and history of a character with ease. You will learn to "get out of the way" of the character so you can discover, rather than contrive, who the character is.


A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15* 

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more. 

___________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: More of, What's in a Character?

results.description:
Join us for an interactive, intergenerational celebration of Thanksgiving! We will read the story of Stone Soup together, which features themes of generosity and community. Then we will share a pot luck salad together. Please see below for details. Hope to see you there! 

Details:

You’ve heard of the story of Stone Soup?  If not, you’ll hear it this week. Our modernized version is called Stone Salad. We’ll celebrate generosity together through a family-friendly pot luck.  Bring some food to share. Bring containers to take some home in case we have more than we need.  There’s no need to make a salad at home, it will “magically” be put together before our very eyes. One bowl of salad will be assembled with no dairy or other animal products, no wheat or gluten products and no nuts, for vegans and those with allergies and sensitivities. All food should be ready-to-eat with no further preparation other than adding it to the bowl or table.

*Also, please bring canned goods and other non-perishable food items to “donate” during our Stone Salad story. We will donate all food items to the Kingsbridge-Riverdale-Marble Hill Food & Hunger Project.

What to Bring?

Below are the items you’ll be bringing, based on the first letter of your last name. If there are two last names in your family, pick the first one.

A-G  – salad greens* and salad dressing for 6-8 people; non-perishable food items to donate

H-L – salad greens* and bread for 6-8 people; non-perishable food items to donate

M-R – salad addition** and something to drink for 6-8 people; non-perishable food items to donate

S-Z – salad addition** and dessert for 6-8 people; non-perishable food items to donateWhat to Do When You Arrive?

Salad dressing, bread, drinks and dessert can be put on the serving tables when you arrive.  Keep your salad greens and salad additions with you in platform as we’ll assemble the salads together as part of the program.

Notes/Clarification

* salad greens: washed and cut/torn into bite-sized pieces of lettuce or other salad greens — make sure that the greens are ready to go right into the salad bowl without further prep.

** salad addition: anything but meat that you’d add to a salad — for example, shredded carrots, sliced bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, sprouts, garbanzo beans, a few chopped hard-boiled eggs, shredded or cubed cheese, croutons, or your favorites (artichokes? zucchini?) … make sure that the items are cut, if appropriate, and ready to go right into a salad without further prep. No meat on this day, please.

<a href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.rysec.org%2Fevent%2Fstone-salad-2015%2F&t=Stone%20Salad%3A%20A%20Family%20Sunday%20%26%20Potluck%20Salad"></a>

results.name: Soccer for fun!

results.description:
Are you looking to BALANCE your training & stretching?

Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

Looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track?

Would you like to RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by combining it with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL balance your whole being in training!

Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements (overuse) on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten in ingrained patterns around muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga class, one can better release tension, move with ease, and benefit from improved posture and injury prevention.  In addition, increased respiratory control and focus have been reported by students.

The Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with series of held Yin floor postures to open the meridian/chakras pathways of the body. While surrendering into the edge of each pose for 2-5 minutes, students are guided in the cultivation of observance and breath, as they experience release of connective tissues and the stagnant energy around the hips, thighs, and lower back. Awareness is emphasized to sensations in the body that are grounding and powerful experience of the NOW. The Yang or moving practice allows students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for circulation, and flexibility, into vigorous strengthening postures and movement sequences. Freedom of breath, alignment, and mental clarity will be elicited deeply during, after the class, and into one's training.

After our INTRO CLASS ON 9/10: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

AND another student reported achieving best time running a 18 mile course...


**10 Classes Only - Join weekly for maximum benefits and donate suggested $15 per class for this this performance enhancing class not offered anywhere else in NYC!


Please message me other days/times for Spring Program Offering considerations.  Thank you!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr
results.name: Yin Yang Yoga for Runners/Athletes - LAST CLASS TIL MID-JANUARY! COME!

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.

results.description:
Tony-winning director Bartlett Sher and the team behind 'The King and I' bring a fresh and authentic vision to this beloved theatrical masterpiece!

You will also meet up to 50 other members before the show at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fiddler/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (12pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets. 

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, closer to event date.  It will start at 12pm and we'll leave at 1:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 2pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $59.50 to $89.50 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot.  

Get your tickets ASAP at this link -  http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fiddler/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w4Ki2Dc9tE

About the Show - 

The original production won ten Tony Awards including a special Tony for becoming the longest-running Broadway musical of all time—and now you can be there when the sun rises on this new production starring Tony nominees Danny Burstein and Jessica Hecht with stunning movement and dance from acclaimed Israeli choreographer Hofesh Shechter based on the original staging by Jerome Robbins. 


A wonderful cast and a lavish orchestra tell this heartwarming story of fathers and daughters, husbands and wives, and the timeless traditions that define faith and family. Featuring the Broadway classics “To Life (L’Chaim!),” “If I Were A Rich Man,” “Sunrise Sunset,” “Matchmaker, Matchmaker,” and “Tradition,” Fiddler On the Roof will introduce a new generation to this uplifting celebration that raises its cup to joy! To love! To life!!

GET TICKETS AT THIS LINK - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fiddler/
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
results.name: Broadway's Hit Musical 'Fiddler On The Roof' w/ Pre-Mingle (Prepay Only)SOLD OUT

results.description:
https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/zurOj01dlTKv4gRlS10l525XaOHnUQG-H3uTmEKj2dr-EQc6NWXMigbaMBATrzsqrqt0UlgM5nNkZMiSZ9gAnlS67dlPlRc6dRCy8I2wTcKlaNVmodMqe8fx-bnoyvtLCA Explore the classic sights of the Peruvian highlands with a fun group of South Asian Professionals! This trip will focus on the amazing sights of the Peruvian Andes including the incomparable Machu Picchu. This area is the heartland of the Incan culture and amazing historic monuments and stories are found in every corner of the mountainous landscape. The Inca culture continues to thrive today - you’ll see local villages, markets and foods that haven’t changed for centuries. In fact you’ll be surprised that the native American culture here is so strong that this is the largest area in the America’s where an indigenous language (Quechua) is still predominant over a European languages such as Spanish, French, English or Portuguese!

In addition to the Incan ruins we’ll experience market towns, church’s, museums, the amazing city of Cuzco, wildlife and the highest lake in the world, Lake Titicaca - all set against the dramatic backdrop of the Andes!


Full Details:  j.mp/ThanksgivingInPeru2015
results.name: Peru Highlands!

results.description:
After more than a century of almost continuous foreign warfare, Rome's attention turned inward. Political and social tensions started to escalate with Roman citizenship kept from Latins, Italians and the growing number of provincials and slaves as well as the confiscation and transformation of small independent farms into large slave-worked estates benefitting the wealthy classes. The growth of slavery increased unemployment,. Homeless veterans added to the ranks of the poor and their plight threatened to undermine Rome's military capability.

The aristocracy, preoccupied with self-enrichment and with a lock on Senate power, ensured that the laws protected their own interests. With no powerful champion for their cause, mobs of poor and disenfranchised Romans grew more frustrated and restless.

Then came the Gracchi....

Suggested Reading:  Roman Lives by Plutarch (see third chapter on the Gracchi)
results.how_to_find_us: Location details will be shared with those attending a few days before the discussion
results.name: The Optimates vs. the Populares

Featuring the Broadway classics “To Life (L’Chaim!),” “If I Were A Rich Man,” “Sunrise Sunset,” “Matchmaker, Matchmaker,” and “Tradition,” Fiddler On the Roof will introduce a new generation to this uplifting celebration that raises its cup to joy! To love! To life!!

results.description:
BRUNCH 
12:00 Noon

Fools Gold NY, 145 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002

b/t East Houston St & 2nd Ave 

Movie: BY THE SEA...with Angelina Jolie & Brad Pitt

SHOWTIME : 2:45 PM

Sunshine Cinema, 143 E. Houston St., New York, NY 10002 

Plot Summary 

Written, directed and produced by Academy Award® winner Angelina Jolie Pitt, By the Sea serves as her directorial follow-up to Universal Pictures’ epic Unbroken.  The dramatic film stars Brad Pitt and Jolie Pitt, who are supported by an international ensemble led by Mélanie Laurent, Melvil Poupaud, Niels Arestrup and Richard Bohringer. 
  By the Sea follows an American writer named Roland (Pitt) and his wife, Vanessa (Jolie Pitt), who arrive in a tranquil and picturesque seaside resort in 1970s France, their marriage in apparent crisis.  As they spend time with fellow travelers, including young newlyweds Lea (Laurent) and François (Poupaud), and village locals Michel (Arestrup) and Patrice (Bohringer), the couple begins to come to terms with unresolved issues in their own lives. 

In its style, and its treatment of themes of the human experience, By the Sea is inspired by European cinema and theater of the ’60s and ’70s.

Cast: Brad Pitt , Angelina Jolie Pitt , Mélanie Laurent ,Melvil Poupaud , Niels Arestrup , Richard Bohringer ,Marika Green , Sarah Naudi

Director: Angelina Jolie Pitt

Genres: Drama, Romance

Critic Reviews

Nov 14,[masked]Jolie Pitt, in her third film as a director, infuses her original screenplay with a sparseness reminiscent of Hemingway’s tales of mislaid love and Michelangelo Antonioni’s cinematic alienation. But By the Sea is its own lovely creation, deadly serious about how grief divides, conquers and possibly unites.HitfixDrew McWeen Nov 11,[masked]It sounds far sexier, just based on the synopsis, than it actually plays, though, so hopefully people aren't sold the wrong movie. For those in the mood for a throwback to the doomed romanticism of mid'60s art films, this feels like about as sincere an homage as anyone could produce.Katie Walsh Nov 6,[masked]Jolie Pitt’s insistence on creating a piece that reflects the harsh inner state of a person suffering to understand herself as a wife and as a woman in the world is commendable, and fascinating in her growth as a filmmaker.New York Magazine (Vulture)Bilge EbiriNov 12,[masked]You keep watching not just because she and Brad and the Mediterranean are beautiful, but also because small, surprising details start to take on great importance. Los Angeles Time Rebecca Keegan

Nov 12,[masked]As a writer, Jolie Pitt is better at ideas than dialogue, much of which is leaden here. But the characters' behaviors feel true. The New York Times Manohla Dargis Nov 12,[masked]At first luxurious blush it’s a jet-setting marital melodrama, one of those he-said, she-said (and wept) encounter sessions decked with designer shades, to-die-for digs and millionaire tears. More interestingly, the movie, which Ms. Jolie Pitt wrote and directed, is a knowing or at least a ticklishly amusing demonstration of celebrity and its relay of gazes from one of the most looked-at women in the world.Slant Magazine Christopher Gray Nov 11,[masked]If it stumbles when it seeks our sympathy, it thrives when it's exploiting our fascination with the surface of things, and all that's unknowable underneath.
results.name: SUNDAY 11/22 BRUNCH@FOOLS GOLD & MOVIE: "BY THE SEA" @SUNSHINE CINEMA

results.description:
Futsal on Sunday afternoons.

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

There will be TWO sessions of 1.5 hours each starting at 12pm for the first session and at 2pm for the second. You will have a chance to RSVP for both. 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins a match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group. Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. No goalies, so no goalkeeping.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

results.description:
Mother Nature is putting on a great show with the leaves turning all kinds of colors, and there's a fall chill in the air.  But we're hoping we can squeeze in one more outdoor Meetup this year! If the weather turns out bad, we'll move indoors.

Please note that the Meetup is Sunday, not Saturday, at 12:00 noon.

As always, there will be lots of yummy treats for all and one lucky doxie will win a prize in our monthly raffle!

YOUR CONTACT INFO

Please check your e-mail and the Web site in case there are last-minute changes to this Meetup. If you would like to be notified by phone, please send a contact number. Remember, if you don't hear otherwise, the Meetup is on at the scheduled date/time.

DIRECTIONS

From 287 East: 

- Take Exit 8W for Bloomingdale Rd/Westchester Mall Pl (mall entrance will be directly ahead of you at end of ramp) 

- Turn RIGHT at light at end of ramp onto Bloomingdale Rd 

- Make next RIGHT onto Westchester Ave 

- Make next LEFT onto S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations 

- Make first RIGHT onto Brockway Pl - just past the car wash and before Best Friends Pet Care 

- You will be driving past some auto body shops. Continue to follow the road around a couple of bends. The park will be on your right just beyond an overpass and across from a baseball field (field #2 of Delfino Park).  

 From 287 West:

- Take Exit 8 for White Plains/Westchester Mall Pl 

- Merge onto Westchester Ave, continue straight about 1/2 mile 

- Turn RIGHT on S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations 

- Follow directions above from S. Kensico Ave.    


If you have any questions, please call Nick's cell phone:[masked]-7040.

results.description:
Updated October 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on weekdays and Morningside Park for weekends.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Damien 
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

results.description:
Go at the Fat Cat Sunday at 12:30 PM There are two go boards available, but you have to ask for them. Just in case, it is recommended that you bring your own board.

Its a great chance to listen to some jazz, play a few games and even have a drink or two.  Fat cat has a decent selection of beers, and allows people to bring in their own food.  If you have been you know its great, if you have never been yet, now is a good time to start.

If you RSVP, you'll get email reminders 6d and 1d before, which should help avoid confusion.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for people with go boards out.
results.name: Go at the FatCat Sundays!

results.description:
Alot of the regulars like this place but we have a lot of new members this year, so I'll explain the Whiskey Rebel.

1) This place has alot of drinks. They used to not have their own food, but now they offer hotdogs, wings, that sort of thing.

2) But they allow us to bring our own food;They even have menus available to order food to be delivered to the place.  if you want to bring something for yourself or to share or nothing at all, that is entirely up to you. You are NOT required to bring anything.

3)We always go all the way to the back of the bar.


4) Don't forget your wallet; there is usually(not always) a bouncer checking ID before you go in. So if you or your guest(s) are under the legal drinking age, I'm sorry. You're going to have to wait till we go back to Nelly Spillanes or another restaurant like that. That's about it.

ROAD TRIP

Prepay is required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5926

Date & Time: Sunday, November 22nd, 2015 
Noon:- 5:00 PM

Male ages: all 
Female ages: all

Cost: $59.75-$89.79 depending on how early you register. 

We will be sitting in the REAR MEZZ 

This event is not meant to be age specific or gender balanced. 

We will meet for a pre-mingle at a local bar/pub (location announced after you register) and then go to see this AMAZING Broadway show. Price includes the ticket to the show (2:00PM) and the pre-mingle (Noon pm).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w4Ki2Dc9tE 

About the Show

Tony-winning director Bartlett Sher and the team behind South Pacific and The King and I bring a fresh and authentic vision to this beloved theatrical masterpiece from Tony winner Joseph Stein and Pulitzer Prize winners Jerry Bock and Sheldon Harnick. The original production won ten Tony Awards including a special Tony for becoming the longest-running Broadway musical of all time—and now you can be there when the sun rises on this new production starring Tony nominees Danny Burstein and Jessica Hecht with stunning movement and dance from acclaimed Israeli choreographer Hofesh Shechter based on the original staging by Jerome Robbins. A wonderful cast and a lavish orchestra tell this heartwarming story of fathers and daughters, husbands and wives, and the timeless traditions that define faith and family. Featuring the Broadway classics “To Life (L’Chaim!),” “If I Were A Rich Man,” “Sunrise Sunset,” “Matchmaker, Matchmaker,” and “Tradition,” Fiddler On the Roof will introduce a new generation to this uplifting celebration that raises its cup to joy! To love! To life

Prepay is required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5926

results.description:
You are invited to our specialized Stress Reduction workshop, which is for moms both PRENATAL and POSTPARTUM

It will cover:

-How stress affects you (physiologically and mentally!)
-How stress affects your baby (before and after birth!)
-How to take care of stress properly (what works best for you!)

We are New Yorkers. Stress is our life.

But that doesn't mean we can't take at least some control of the kinds of stressors in our lives and more importantly how we react to them.

This workshop is invaluable. We could ALL use some more knowledge and personal tactics to tackle such issues, especially given that they affect everyone around us INCLUDING our babies.

*Some healthy snacks, drinks and related materials will be provided. Please let us know if you have any suggestions!


Also, it is best to bring a pen, paper and an open mind =)

___________________________________________________

Please RSVP here and feel free to introduce yourself in the comments section!
Contact Eva for any further questions.

(If you cannot make the time listed but you would like to attend this workshop, please comment or send Eva a message and perhaps we can accommodate).

*All events are sponsored by Bria Body. Please visit BriaBody.com to learn more.
results.name: Stress on Our Bodies and Our Babies

group.name: Pregnancy and Postnatal Body + Mind Workshops (FREE)

The package is 14 dollars from anytime between 1:00pm and 8:00pm. If you are the earliest you can just post what room you are in and start singing, people will join you as they come in. There is no minimum for rooms and you pay the 14 dollars in the beginning so switching rooms and leaving rooms early is also easy.

The bar is half price all day and there are many delivery menus to order food from.

These are not all the songs they have though. If you don't find your song here it might still be in the system some where.

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

Please join  us for one of my favorite exhibits at the Museum of Natural History called the Butterfly Conservatory: Tropical Butterflies Alive in Winter.

Here is the link for admission price, and more info:

http://www.timeout.com/newyork/attractions/the-butterfly-conservatory-tropical-butterflies-alive-in-winter-4#tab_panel_2

I've seen this exhibit in the past and it is unprecedented in my opinion ;)

If you even remotely enjoy the sight/ company of butterflies and want to experience them at their best, in a serene, and beautiful habitat then please join us.

We will spend a few hours perusing the museum ( since there will be other exhibits that might interest you).

We can then sit and have early dinner or late lunch/cocktail at Isabellas on Columbus Ave one of many personal favorites at 4pm on Sunday, 11/22.


here is the link for menu/prices: http://www.isabellas.com/.

This is a Reservations only venue: please email me personally [masked] or on meetup to


reserve your place at the table. Only 10 reservations will be honored.

When you hit Yes to RSVP on Meetup Site, you are telling me that you will be joining us at the Museum.


I must get a separate notification from you on meetup or by email if you wish to join for dinner.


So let's work on the honor system here: if you and realize you cannot make it for the meal please contact me ( do not change your RSVP on meetup).

I will then let the group know your spot has opened up.

I look froward to seeing you all for the last meetup in November.

Stay tuned for a Fun Upscale Bowling Meetup and a Visit to the Jazz Museum in Dec.

I Look forward to seeing you soon.

Enjoy this balmy weather while it lasts.!

Cheers,

Carly

PS will pass an envelope for first timers to help me offset expense of meetup.com site operation.
results.name: Visit "The Butterfly Conservatory" at the AMNH and late lunch at Isabella's

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in English conversation practice. The goal of this group is to have a place for people to meet and practice their English. I am a former English teacher and a native English speaker. All skill levels are welcome. This is a chance to practice your English conversation with a native English speaker and to have me correct your speaking or a chance to ask me any questions you might have about pronunciation or English grammar or anything else! No set plan for the class, we can just talk and have a conversation about any topics you want!
results.name: Let's meet and have a casual conversation!

group.name: New York English as a Second Language Conversation Meetup

results.description:
*Don't forget - the anti -fur conference is the day before!
Let's cap off a great anti-fur weekend with an energetic march & protest!

Please join for our annual march down Central Park South, past the exclusive shops and hotels, spreading our message of compassion.

Activists are invited to gather at Columbus Circle between 1:00 and 1:15pm. At 1:15, those gathered will march down Central Park South to Bergdorf-Goodman 754 Fifth Avenue (between 57th and 58th Streets), where the protest will be staged from 1:30-3pm.

WHERE: Bergdorf Goodman, 5th Ave btwn 57th & 58th Sts, NYC.
WHEN: Sunday, Nov. 22nd, 2015.
TIME: 1 ~ 3pm

DETAILS: Activists are invited to gather at Columbus Circle between 1:00 and 1:15pm. At 1:15, those gathered will march to Bergdorf-Goodman, where the protest will be staged from 1:30-3pm. WE will have plenty of heart-shaped signs, literature and relevant props to share with interested members of the general public. All YOU need to bring is yourself and your voice to speak up for the voiceless, who cannot articulate their own wish to freely live out their lives under the sun, to frolic and to bear young, to behave in accordance with their own natures with no interference from our species. Come out and be a voice for the voiceless!

As the weather slowly moves in a colder direction, please come and help us get the word out that compassion is the fashion, and fur is DEAD! Caring Activists Against Fur (CAAF), will be making our immutable opposition to the horrific Chinese fur trade known to those unscrupulous cretins whose livelihood is the confinement, torture and extraordinarily brutal extermination of innocent beings - all in the name of fickle "luxury" and transient, superfluous "fashion."
Come and add your voice to a burgeoning group of energetic animal activists whose prime directive is to elevate public awareness about the plight of innumerable defenseless foxes, minks, raccoons, dogs and cats and other mammal victims of the gruesome Chinese fur trade, who are violently and systematically removed from their natural habitats, corralled into inescapable death camps, crammed into tiny, filthy cages for months in ALL weather conditions, beaten, stomped on, anally electrocuted, gassed, bludgeoned to death, even SKINNED ALIVE so that affluent first-world consumers can gleefully, obliviously parade around, morbidly draped in the skins that are, quite literally, ripped off these animals' backs as they helplessly writhe in overwhelming shock and agony 'til the final throes of death overtake them. These pathetic, skinless creatures will often suffer in mortal agony for minutes or hours - all for vain, pretentious, human notions of "luxury apparel" and "fashion."

WHERE: Gather 1:00 Columbus Circle & March down Central Park South @1:15 to Bergdorf Goodman, 5th Ave btwn 57th & 58th Sts, NYC - protest 1:30 - 3:00
WHEN: Sunday, November 22, 2015.
TIME: 1:00 Columbus Circle, 1:30 - 3:00 Bergdorf Goodman
results.name: CAAF Anti Fur Conference Wknd Anti Fur March down CPS to Bergdorf-Goodman

results.description:
November 22, 2015

Spells and How They Work

Writing Spells Crafting Spells Spells for any purpose Timing for spells Spells in rituals Besom - The Witches Broom Introduction & Practice of the Witches Alphabet When was it formed What do they mean Secrecy Runes Angelic symbols $25 in person/$27 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
ATTENTION: It is imperative that we have accurate attendance for this photowalk, so please RSVP if you are seriously attending.  If you RSVP and cannot make it, please change it from "yes" to "no" before the deadline.  The list will be handed over to our host YourArtGallery.com with the final count.

We will be meeting under the Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Arch at the Grand Army Plaza at 1pm sharp!  The closest subway stations are: 

2, 3, 4 @ Grand Army Plaza
B, Q, @ 7th Avenue
2, 3, 4 @ Eastern Parkway - Brooklyn Museum

The staff of YourArtGallery will introduce themselves and provide us with brief information of who they are, before they lead us into Prospect Park to take photographs along the west side.  Also, Brooklyn Born will provide a quick overview on one or two topics in photography during the walk.

• Dress appropriate for the weather and wear comfy shoes.

• Pack light; don't forget your charged batteries and empty memory cards.


• As always, please be on time. Allow yourself enough travel time and check the MTA for any subway updates. I won’t be able to take calls and messages after the meetup starts.

Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are.


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927)

********************

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

********************

We have had problems with people cancelling at the last minute. So, we changed the rule. Think twice before you RSVP yes. Then, if you really need to cancel, do so as soon as possible, and the last chance to cancel is 2 hours before the game (so, 11am). This is because you may be taking the spot of someone who wants to play if cancel to late.

2) Come on time or don't play.

results.description:
Hey folks, let's walk across the awesome Williamsburg Bridge and then get some grub at Katz's Deli on Houston St. in Manhattan!!

We should meet at the statue of George Washington at Continental Army Plaza at S. 4th Street and S. 5th Place.

From there we'll walk/run/jog/crawl along the lovely bridge, take some pictures halfway through, then walk down and head north and west to Katz's Deli, for some awesome brisket, latkes, hotdogs, or whatever your pleasure demands. The F/J/M/Z trains are all close by so its easy to get back to Brooklyn.  

We can then head over to Economy Candy, which has a HUGE selection of all the candies you could ever imagine, and then we will head back over the bridge to burn off some of those extra caleries.

http://www.economycandy.com/


https://sp.yimg.com/ib/th?id=HN.608027039968069035&pid=15.1&P=0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w4Ki2Dc9tE About the Show

Tony-winning director Bartlett Sher and the team behind South Pacific and The King and I bring a fresh and authentic vision to this beloved theatrical masterpiece from Tony winner Joseph Stein and Pulitzer Prize winners Jerry Bock and Sheldon Harnick. The original production won ten Tony Awards including a special Tony for becoming the longest-running Broadway musical of all time—and now you can be there when the sun rises on this new production starring Tony nominees Danny Burstein and Jessica Hecht with stunning movement and dance from acclaimed Israeli choreographer Hofesh Shechter based on the original staging by Jerome Robbins. A wonderful cast and a lavish orchestra tell this heartwarming story of fathers and daughters, husbands and wives, and the timeless traditions that define faith and family. Featuring the Broadway classics “To Life (L’Chaim!),” “If I Were A Rich Man,” “Sunrise Sunset,” “Matchmaker, Matchmaker,” and “Tradition,” Fiddler On the Roof will introduce a new generation to this uplifting celebration that raises its cup to joy! To love! To life

Prepay is required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5926

results.description:
In her early sixties Bobbie Horowitz needed to restore her shape and health. She relentlessly researched options and designed her plan, which worked so well, others asked her for help. She designed a coaching system that’s helped many design their own path to fitness - and have FUN doing it. FUN is what keeps them at it. She titled her book “Fit and Fabulous From Fifty Forward!” because she wants to reach the ears of “older “people, many of whom had given up trying to be fit. Please note that the plan she uses works equally well for teens and people of any age.

In this inspiring workshop, Bobbie will guide each participant to learn how to find out what works for your individual body and how to begin to design his/her, what she calls, "Simple Daily Get To Do List" that will lead your particular body to become as healthy and fit as possible as quickly as possible and will be fun to do on a daily basis.You'll learn what questions about your body you need to ask and places you can begin to search for these answers, and Bobbie will give you tips for being patient in getting results.

Presented on a love offering basis.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

This circular walk is moderate paced (not slow paced). If you think that you will be lagging behind, then this type of walk is not good for you. We'll be walking about 4 1/2 miles. This walk is mostly flat with one gradual uphill.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. Although I will comment on some things (the architecture and the social history of Hoboken as well as Frank Sinatra) along the way, this is not one of my walking tours.

Description: In addition to seeing spectacular riverfront scenery and magnificent historic architecture, we will be walking past several points of interest about Frank Sinatra, who was born (Dec. 12, 1915) and raised in Hoboken.

We will first take a stroll through Frank Sinatra's old neighborhoods, which are in the back end of Hoboken. Then, on our way back to the Hoboken Terminal, we'll be walking through the campus of Stevens Institute of Technology, which is atop the cliffs and the highest point in Hoboken. The campus has great views of the Hudson River and the Manhattan skyline.

Below was Frank Sinatra in his tough, working-class neighborhood in Hoboken, circa 1920s. (Source Frank Sinatra: The Family Album, 2007)


Below was Frank Sinatra with his first love, Nancy Barbato in Hoboken, in 1932

Below are some of the places that we will be walking by in Hoboken. 

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is at the benches in the waiting room of the Hoboken PATH/NJ Railroad Terminal. Before the walk, restrooms are located in the waiting room area.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Below is the Beaux-Arts waiting room at the Hoboken PATH/ NJ Railroad Terminal.

Transportation (from Manhattan): Take the PATH subway train (from Midtown or Greenwich Village) to the HOBOKEN TERMINAL in Hoboken, New Jersey. From Midtown or Greenwich Village, you could take the PATH train from the following PATH stations: 33rd Street/6th Avenue, 23rd Street/6th Avenue, 14th Street/6th Street, 9th Street/6th Avenue, or Christopher Street (between Hudson Street and Greenwich Street.) Once in New Jersey, the PATH subway train's 1st stop is the Hoboken Terminal. Depending on where you get  the PATH subway system, this PATH subway train ride can take up to 17 minutes. This PATH subway train goes directly to Hoboken without changing to another train.


The PATH subway fare is $2.75 each way. You can use a NYC paid-per-ride to pay the fare, but cannot use a NYC unlimited MetroCard or NYC Senior MetroCard.


A Senior PATH Smartlink Card (can download an application online) ride costs $1.00 each way if you are 65 years or older. 

Transportation (from New Jersey):  An option is to take a NJ transit railroad train to the Hoboken PATH/NJ Transit Terminal.

Transportation (Driving): If you want to take your car to Hoboken for the walk, please go to the website below to find out about the parking regulations on the weekend in Hoboken.

http://www.hobokennj.org/departments/transportation-parking/parking/


Finishing Time/Place: This circular walk finishes about 5:15 PM back at the PATH/NJ Transit Hoboken Terminal.

Rainy weather cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice Sunday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. (If I do cancel the walk, I will also post the cancellation in the Discussion Board.)

Below is the 1954 film On the Waterfront starring Marlon Brando and Eva Marie Saint. On the Waterfront was filmed on location, mostly in Hoboken. Many conversations (or flirtations)between the two characters took place in Hoboken.

Below was Frank Sinatra (who is wearing a white shirt with an open collar) being mobbed by his fans outside of Hoboken's City Hall in 1947. Several years later, Frank Sinatra, a Hoboken native, was nearly used for the starring role in On the Waterfront until Marlon Brando, Elia Kazan's 1st choice, accepted the role at the last minute. (Source Hoboken Historical Museum)

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Glamour and Speed Bike Shoot - w/Diana & Jessica - Nov. 22nd"


We are looking forward to this months group shoot as we present to you two new models I've had the pleasure of working with, Diana and Jessica. They are both new to the Meetup world but are not new to group shoots and as such take direction well and are so much fun to work with that you'll forget you are in the middle of a shoot. We also have a special treat as one of our member, Ed, will be bringing his speed bike for us to use for this shoot.

About the Shoot:

For this shoot, we have planned out 3 glamour looks. We'll start with a sexy, casual look to shoot outdoor. (Weather permitting, we'll be able to shoot a look with the bike outdoors also.) We have planned a lingerie look for the second style. For the indoor bike shoot, we have planned either swimwear (like in the bike mags) or/also an edgier bad ass look. (As there is one bike, there will be another setup to shoot at till the models switch stations.)

RSVP:

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup so you know what to expect at the shoot. 

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page.

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $25 (Paypal)

(Balance due at time of shoot: $55, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models: 

(Courtesy of Jeff Black Models) Modeling page links will be updated as I receive them.

Diana Dee:

Jessica Skinner: (Photos provided by booking agent.) 

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]

results.description:
Featuring 70 hand-crafted costumes from the first six blockbuster Star Wars™ films, this exhibition reveals the artists’ creative process—and uncovers the connection between character and costume. George Lucas imagined and created a fantastical world filled with dynamic characters who told the timeless story of the hero’s journey. The costumes shaped the identities of these now famous characters, from the menacing black mask of Darth Vader and the gilded suit of C-3PO, to the lavish royal gowns of Queen Amidala and a bikini worn by Princess Leia when enslaved by Jabba the Hutt. A special presentation for the showing at Discovery Times Square in New York will feature seven additional costumes from the highly anticipated film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

Miriam and her daughter and I am my son are going into the city to see this exhibition. Anyone who wants to is more than welcome to meet us there.

I plan to drive us in as I know how to find cheap parking but I only have room for the 4 of us. If others want to drive in I can tell you my parking info once I book it. Or you can train it or bus it or ferry in, whatever way you are accustomed to getting to the city. We got tickets for the 2pm entrance time on Nov 22nd. I imagine we will walk around NY some afterwards and grab some dinner somewhere in the area.

Buy your tickets here in advance:  https://www.showclix.com/event/StarWarsDTS

Hope to see YOU in Times Square!  Love, Cassie

ok I bought parking for $35 right next to this place...225 W 44th street, I reserved from 1 to 9pm so we can hang out for awhile. here is the link if anyone else is driving in: http://www.iconparkingsystems.com/reservations/astor-parking-llc/

results.description:
Please join us for November 2015's discussion of Janet Mock's "Redefining Realness". Please come with an open mind, a spirit of fellowship, and a point of view. The reservation for the restaurant requires that you cannot arrive later than 2:15pm. There is also a $15 minimum order for food. Having said that...this should be FUN!

Can't wait to see you there!

Christina

***Book Synopsis***
In 2011, Marie Claire magazine published a profile of Janet Mock in which she stepped forward for the first time as a trans woman. Those twenty-three hundred words were life-altering for the People.com editor, turning her into an influential and outspoken public figure and a desperately needed voice for an often voiceless community. In these pages, she offers a bold and inspiring perspective on being young, multicultural, economically challenged, and transgender in America. Welcomed into the world as her parents’ firstborn son, Mock decided early on that she would be her own person—no matter what. She struggled as the smart, determined child in a deeply loving yet ill-equipped family that lacked the money, education, and resources necessary to help her thrive. Mock navigated her way through her teen years without parental guidance, but luckily, with the support of a few close friends and mentors, she emerged much stronger, ready to take on—and maybe even change—the world. This powerful memoir follows Mock’s quest for identity, from an early, unwavering conviction about her gender to a turbulent adolescence in Honolulu that saw her transitioning during the tender years of high school, self-medicating with hormones at fifteen, and flying across the world alone for sex reassignment surgery at just eighteen. With unflinching honesty, Mock uses her own experience to impart vital insight about the unique challenges and vulnerabilities of trans youth and brave girls like herself. Despite the hurdles, Mock received a scholarship to college and moved to New York City, where she earned a master’s degree, enjoyed the success of an enviable career, and told no one about her past. She remained deeply guarded until she fell for a man who called her the woman of his dreams. Love fortified her with the strength to finally tell her story, enabling her to embody the undeniable power of testimony and become a fierce advocate for a marginalized and misunderstood community. A profound statement of affirmation from a courageous woman, Redefining Realness provides a whole new outlook on what it means to be a woman today, and shows as never before how to be authentic, unapologetic, and wholly yourself.
results.name: "Redefining Realness" by Janet Mock

results.description:
Join us for an afternoon of Japanese & English language exchange! We will be meeting this Sunday, February 1, from 3-5PM--45 minutes of each language, and then free exchange during the last half hour.

This week's discussion will be about our favorite places to travel! 

Due to feedback saying the articles are too difficult to read, we will skip the pre-reading this time. Instead, please think about how you would answer these questions:

What are your 3 most favorite vacation spots, and why?
あなたのバケーション・スポットのベスト3は、何だと思いますか？

Name 3 places you would love to visit, and why?
あなたがぜひ行きたい場所は、どこだと思いますか？

What is your "perfect vacation"?
あなたは、どんなケーションが最適だと思いますか？

Which is more fun: Planning a trip beforehand, or going somewhere with no plans?
ある旅に、前に準備すると、ノープランで行ってみると、どっちのほうが楽しいですか？

We would like to have 10 Japanese learners and 10 English learners attend this event, so please check the RSVP list before signing up. If you see that your section is already full, please send me an e-mail at [masked] and I will put you on waitlist in the event that a spot becomes free.

And please take our survey if you haven't already. We want to know what interests you and what Ameripon can do to better your English/Japanese learning experience.

Looking forward to chatting/しゃべる'ing with all of you this Sunday. お楽しみ！

-Kevin（ケビン）
Organizer, Ameripon

results.description:
[Cross-posted from NYC Stoics]

At the last meetup, we ended with Becker's version of the oikeiosis argument. Its purpose was to show that Stoic doctrines, partially redefined by Becker as the perfection of agency, can fall out of the natural development of the human psyche, and are thus in a sense "in accordance with nature (or "the facts")." However, the argument we covered last time was purely descriptive. This raises the question: what prescriptive arguments are there for Becker's New Stoicism? 


In this meetup, we will complete our reading of A New Stoicism by tackling this question along with perhaps the most important question of them all: what exactly does Stoicism qua perfected agency have to do with happiness? To prepare, please complete Chapter 6, starting from the subsection "The Argument for Virtue as the Perfection of Agency" and all of Chapter 7. The commentaries for each chapter, along with the appendix, are optional and will not be discussed.

At the end of this meetup, we'll also discuss whether or not we'll have a meetup in December, and also consider some possible themes to cover for our group in 2016.

Below are some study questions to help guide your reading of the rest of Becker's book. As usual, please try your best to answer these questions for yourself as you do the reading. We'll be discussing some, but not all, of them during the meetup. Also highlight any passages or concepts you'd like to bring up for discussion as well.

Study questions

Rest of Chapter 6

• What is the argument for virtue as the perfection of agency?

• Does the above argument apply to everyone? 

• Should healthy human agents all be alike?

• How should Stoics deal with non-Stoics of a different psychology according to Becker?

• Does Becker fully believe that virtue is all-or-nothing? 

• What argument does Becker give for the all-or-nothing nature of virtue?

• What argument does he give that virtue is the only good? 

• What does Becker mean by calling virtue "incommensurable"? 

Chapter 7

• What is the ideal frame of reference to develop one's agency? 

• Describe Becker's version of "a complete life." 

• How does Becker reframe the ancient Stoic idea of preferred indifferents? 

• Are narratives and life-plans necessary for Stoic practice?

• Becker states that there's evidence that both healthy and unhealthy primal traits become fixed in childhood and that from this "some important norms for moral education follow rather directly." What do you think these norms are? 

• Becker claims that "being overcome by emotion is not more problematic for a stoic than being overcome by sleep" and that it's the "ability to stop feelings (or break attachments) suddenly, when practical intelligence calls for it" that matters. Is this consonant or different from the ancient Stoic view, and why? 

• How does a sage suffer on the rack differently than a non-sage? 

• What role does joy play in Becker's Stoicism?
results.name: A New Stoicism: Finale

results.description:
Please join us on Sunday for meditation instruction and sitting practice. Developed for beginners as well as experienced meditators, this afternoon session will include guided instruction by an experienced teacher, and discussion and opportunity for questions and comments. More details:http://www.theidproject.org/events/2015/05/03/sundays-weekly-introduction-meditation 

Recent scientific research suggests that meditation practice is an effective means to lessening stress and depression, boosting bodily immune and respiratory functions, increasing happiness and cultivating compassion and joy within one's life.

Please arrive by 2:50 to settle into your seat for the program. Chairs and cushions will be available. We request a $5-$10 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds. 

Note we are located on the 2nd Floor of a walkup building.  We have no elevator. 

The Interdependence Project 
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer 
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30pm-6pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Hello Friends,
Last meetup the highlight of our experience was doing Stage one Zhineng Qigong and an extended LaQi then we harnessed the built up Qi field to create healing for a couple practitioners. They were also participating in their own healing.

Beginners and experienced Qigong Practitioners are welcome to join us next Sunday 22nd Nov @ 4-6pm.

Our aim is to do Stage one Zhineng Qigong for two repetitions (about 20 min each). We will work more of the imaginative thought process into the movements. To facilitate this the audio guide will not be used but someone will lead the practice.

Then, we'll further build the Qi field by doing LaQi for about 10 min after which Laurelle Rethke will lead the imaginative thought process of directing the mind Qi to create healing.

We will focus more on the details of the movements so that beginners can pick up the movements. There will be lots of time for questions and clarifications.

PS: Laurelle Rethke has many years of experience of working with energy healing, see her bio here -

www.5sensehealing.com

results.description:
The Museum of Interesting Things

Announces

A Special Pre-Thanksgiving Holiday Party!!!

Featuring the Delicious

Cuisine of Southern India 

Plus admission gets you 

+ a FREE Cooking Class of historic Indian cooking! 

+ FREE gifts! + PARTY! 

+ Free admission to the Museum Secret Speakeasy at 6pm with 1800's and early 1900's cooking items and inventions!

All to show our THANKS! 

To ALL of YOU on

Sunday November 22 at 4pm-6pm

$20 Admission includes

Menu

Chick Pea Kootu – Garbanzo beans and tropical vegetables cooked in a thick, rich stew of coconut and spices

Rasam – A savory South Indian soup made in the traditional way with healing spices

Upuma – A tasty gluten free, low glycemic millet dish cooked in medicinal herbs

Kosamali Salad – Tossed moong beans, mango fruit and coriander leaves

… and you get a free one hour seminar and cooking class by Uma Swaminathan - the author of the book: 

Herbal Transformations - who will

* Tell you about the amazing health benefits of the meal that you are enjoying

* Give you step by step instructions in a live kitchen on how to make two of the dishes so you can right away cook them on your own

* Explain the exact ingredients and proportions of herbs and spices in two essential masala recipes that will improve your health and vitality

Uma has also agreed to give everyone here that evening a FREE booklet that has all the recipes of the dinner plus everything discussed in her talk so that no-one has to worry about taking notes. PLUS PLUS, she will send everyone a video of the evening’s lecture and cooking demonstration for ABSOLUTELY FREE!

On top of that, I’m giving everyone FREE ADMISSION to the Museum of Interesting Things for anyone who wants to stick around after the dinner. We’ll keep the party running well into 11pm!

This is a celebration! I feel so lucky to be able to give you all this. A dinner like this cannot be found in any Indian restaurant unless you are in India or have an Indian friend who has a grandmother who cooks real traditional Indian food. A dinner like this and cooking class would be $35 minimum, but I worked it out with Uma and we both decided to give you all this for only $20!

I’m certainly looking forward to seeing everyone at this very special evening dinner party and celebration!

This is a loungie soho loft....not dinner seating.

In the spirit of a true Speakeasy

Anything can change so...

Please check this website before leaving.

http://www.secretspeakeasy.com/indiancookingclass.html

The Loft at Prince Street 177 Prince Str

Between Thompson & Sullivan street 

in Soho NYC[masked]

$20 Space is limited so you should get advance tickets for indian dinner

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/healthy-indian-thanksgiving-dinner-lesson-party-tickets-19289074140
