results.description:
If you are looking to introduce meditation in your life or meditate with a group, join us for this free one hour session. 

You will get to learn about our mind, and how we can achieve a happy and peaceful state of mind through breath & meditation. 

You will get a taste of the peace and clarity one can achieve through guided meditation & breathing techniques. 

The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. 

You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life. 

More @ Behappymc.org

Please note change of date. Prior to meeting please message with me with vocabulary you would like to discuss: 

Please review Hegel glossary at http://www.london.ac.uk/fileadmin/documents/students/philosophy/ba_course_materials/ba_19thc_hegel_glossary_01.pdf

Please note the link for Kojeve shown here worked As of February 10, 2015.


Please note that we are going to meet at a new salad place, Fresh & Company, 58 East 8th Street,  across the street from our usual place. This actually the location where we met for years when it was Au Bon Pain.

We are accommodating members who are joining late with reviews as needed of previous material We took a look at Sense Certainty last week. Suggest a review of Perception for the next meeting.

We should refer as always to the appropriate Bernstein tapes. Finally, in the Introduction to the Reading of Hegel: Lectures on the Phenomenology of Spirit by Alexandre Kojève, Raymond Queneau, Allan Bloom and James H. Nichols (Oct 31, 1980) we should read Chapter 5.


Note new resource:

Kojeve available used on Amazon for $9.94 plus shipping or free online PDF at: http://www.scribd.com/doc/36163876/Alexandre-Kojeve-Introduction-to-the-Reading-of-Hegel

Included here for review is the glossary available online:

http://www.london.ac.uk/fileadmin/documents/students/philosophy/ba_course_materials/ba_19thc_hegel_glossary_01.pdf


For those new to the group we are delighted that you are joining us. Please review the beginning of the Hegel text: A. Consciousness, I. Sense certainty with attention to Hegel's process and derivation of the universal.

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on reading portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Every other Sunday from 4:30pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後4時半～7時 (二週間ごとに二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson in the third chapter of his Wildpig Exclusive RPG "Sailing Against the Wind"! A great game for both new and returning players of 6th Level.

The crew of the Salty Cormorant, now united by shared adversity, have arrived at the open-sea trading city of Stilt-Sands, but all is not as it seems. The colors of the Eye blanket the town, and terrible creatures prowl the piers, ignored by the populace. Join the erstwhile pirates and sailors as they attempt to discover and uproot the source of such horrors.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Eye Over the Stilt-Sands

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 5PM to 5:30PM, then we begin the show at 5 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 8PM.


This week we have:


Episode 3 "</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lord_Snow">What Is Dead May Never Die"

Episode 4 "</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garden_of_Bones">Garden of Bones"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.

NOTE- Newbies must identify themselves so us Maesters will have notice that you are there so we turn off MST3000 level of commentary!


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 2 Episodes 3 & 4

group.name: New York Game of Thrones Meetup

results.description:
NEW MONTHLY SERIES ‘INDIA’S NEW WAVE’ CONTINUES WITH M. MANIKANDAN'S BREAKOUT DEBUT, THE CROW'S EGG.


To showcase the work of some of the most exciting voices in contemporary Indian cinema today, Museum of the Moving Image will present a new monthly series, India’s New Wave. 


The series continues Sunday, November 22 @ 5PM, with "The Crow's Egg," writer, director, and cinematographer M. Manikandan’s breakout debut feature. 

"THE CROW'S EGG" November 22 @ 5PM

In Tamil with English subtitles. 

With Vignesh Ramesh, Iyshwarya Rajesh.

When a pizza parlor opens on the site of their old playground in Chennai, carefree and spirited slum kids Big Crow’s Egg and Little Crow’s Egg develop a newfound obsession to taste their first pie, and embark on a money-making adventure that draws in the entire city. 


Tickets: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students)

Reserve your ticket in advance TODAY and please help spread the word!

More info + Tickets: http://www.movingimage.us/india

See you there!


Geoffrey
results.name: Movie Night: The Crow's Egg

ARGUABLY, IT IS NEW YORK CITY'S HOTTEST & NEWEST & MOST ELEGANT ROOFTOP & LOUNGE  OVERLOOKING THE SKYLINE OF MAGNIFICENT MANHATTAN, THE MAJESTIC HUDSON AND WONDROUS NEW JERSEY IN THE DISTANCE. AND IT ALL HAPPENS FROM 5 PM - 12 AM.  

AND FROM 5:30-7:30 PM, GEORGE BERNARD WILL PROVIDE A COMPLIMENTARY, GENEROUS AND  SUMPTUOUS HOT & COLD INTERNATIONAL BUFFET DINNER AND A SPECIAL SERVER  WITH AN EXPRESS LINE TO MOVE YOU QUICKLY THROUGH THE BUFFET STATION. YOU WILL BE TREATED TO A GIGANTIC DANCE FLOOR,  AN EXPERIENCE YOU WILL FIND BOTH AWESOME AND ARCHITECTURALLY EXCELLENT.

SUNDAY,  NOVEMBER 22

THE ATTIC ROOFTOP & LOUNGE

EACH PERSON ENTERING THIS EVENT HAS A CHANCE TO WIN TICKETS TO THE CRITICALLY-ACCLAIMED PRODUCTION OF "CLEVER LITTLE LIES" WITH MARLO THOMAS AND A STRONG SUPPORTING CAST."  BUT IN ORDER TO PARTICIPATE YOU MUST BRING YOUR INVITATIONS WITH YOU OR A BUSINESS CARD!

A play by Joe DiPietro. Directed by David Saint


DIRECT FROM TWO CRITICALLY ACCLAIMED SOLD-OUT RUNS!  

"SPLENDID. A FIRST-RATE CAST!"- NY Times

MARLO THOMAS GREG MULLAVEY

GEORGE MERRICK KATE WETHERHEAD Emmy, Grammy & Golden Globe Award winner MARLO THOMAS returns to the stage in CLEVER LITTLE LIES, the outrageous new comedy of sex, love and secrets. For the first time since his acclaimed record-breaking run of I LOVE YOU, You're PERFECT, NOW CHANGE, Tony Award winner JOE DiPIETRO (Memphis) brings his newest comedy to the historic Westside Theatre, with direction by George Street Playhouses Artistic Director DAVID SAINT.

A mother always knows when something is wrong. When Alice (MARLO THOMAS) notices her beloved husband Bill (GREG MULLAVEY) has returned home on edge after a tennis match with their son, she grows suspicious and springs into action. Determined to piece together the puzzle, she invites her son, Bill, Jr. (GEORGE MERRICK), and daughter-in-law, Jane (KATE WETHERHEAD), over for drinks and dessert. Sidesplitting chaos ensues as Alice digs for the truth, resulting in even more honesty than anyone expected. Shattering and hilarious, Clever Little Lies is a story of long-term love and marriage for better and for worse.

results.description:
Our Mindful Astoria book club pick for this fall/winter is The Happiness Hypothesis by Jonathan Haidt. 


The Astoria Bookshop will be offering a 10% discount for anyone in our group if you purchase it through them ($16.99 before tax and discount). Please email me ASAP to let me know if you would like to have a copy ordered for you. It will take the bookshop about a week to get the books in. Our book discussion will be Sunday November 22nd at 5pm. Hope you will join us there.

This event is free, but please consider buying the book through the Astoria Bookshop to support local business and thank them for giving us the space to meet.

Note: you do not have to have read the entire book to attend.

There will be a very brief guided mindfulness meditation during this meeting. No prior meditation experience necessary.

About the book:

This is a book about ten great ideas. Each chapter is an attempt to savor one idea that has been discovered by several of the world’s civilizations -­ to question it in light of what we now know from scientific research, and to extract from it the lessons that still apply to our modern lives. It is a book about how to construct a life of virtue, happiness, fulfillment, and meaning.
results.name: Book Discussion and Meditation at the Astoria Bookshop

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .

We host events and activities around three guiding principles:

DIALOGUE: Build a positive community spirit and provide a safe and nurturing environment for G&L parishioners at St. Paul’s.

SERVICE: Leverage the talents of G&L parishioners to focus on needs within the G&L community in NYC.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description: élan is a contemporary American restaurant by Chef David Waltuck. This would be the David Waltuck of Chanterelle fame, the celebrated fixture of downtown dining for 30 years. The restaurant’s name reflects the energy and style of both the food and setting: a casual yet sophisticated space and a menu that aims to strike a balance between refined and whimsical. Chef Waltuck’s cuisine draws on his experience and interests and takes inspiration from classic French as well as Chinese takeout. The bar area features a six-month rotating art installation by established and emerging artists. The price of our three-course dinner includes coffee, tax, and tip. You can see the current menu at http://www.elannyc.com/prixfixe.html.
results.name: Dinner at élan

This time we'll be going to Tamba Indian Grill and Bar, a fine Indian place in Murray Hill.  They have both vegetarian and meat dishes.  A menu is here.

A $5 deposit is required to RSVP, which will be refunded in cash at the event, 10 minutes after it starts.  No-shows and latecomers forfeit their deposit.  If you change your RSVP to "no" more than 24 hours before the event, you will receive a refund electronically.

Note that if you are on the wait list and a spot opens up, you will not be automatically promoted to a "Yes" RSVP.  You will have to pay your $5 deposit to become a "Yes" when a spot opens up, so be vigilant.


The world of espionage has changed radically in recent years.  Some aspects of spying have gotten easier, while others have gotten harder.  Article here.


Young people nowadays are spending a huge amount of time on electronic devices.  Is this healthy?

This article on Alternet says it's impossible to be "fiscally conservative and socially liberal".  It makes many questionable claims, one of them being that "deregulation caused the financial crisis" without mentioning the repeal of which specific regulation was to blame.  Another questionable maneuver is calling poverty a "social" issue -- it is an economic one.

results.description:
Dear Group Members,

After a great summer and a small break from our monthly series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’, I am very happy and honor to announce that our second edition of The Flame Festival is coming out next NOVEMBER 20TH – 22ND, 6pm- 7:30pm at Cornelia Street Café showcasing the unique work of some of the musicians whom has been part of our series. I want to take the time as well to thank you all for supporting the series by coming to our performances.

The festival will close on Sunday 22nd with a tribute to the ancestral origins of Flamenco with the quartet INFLAME.

November 22nd
6pm – 7.30pm. Not to be missed!!!
$15 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)

About InFlame

Inflame combines classical Indian and traditional Flamenco forms as a launching pad for adventurous improvisation. Formed in 2010, the quartet consists of north Indian mandolin, tabla, flamenco guitar and flamenco percussion. Recent performances include the Arts & Ideas festival in Connecticut, University of South Carolina, and University of West Virginia. Group members hail from Kolkata India, Bangladesh, Buenos Aires Argentina, and New York City. Inflame is: Snehasish Mozumder (Mandolin), Ranendra Kumar Das (Tabla), Cristian Puig (Flamenco guitar), Peter Basil Bogdanos (Flamenco cajon & percussion).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nvJez5VWmXg

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ with InFlame

group.name: New York Latinos for The Arts

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

results.description:
Our Annual Pot Luck Dinner is one of our favorite and biggest events of the year!  We invite members old and new to join us for an awesome feast following the 5:30 mass in the George Murphy Parish Center Under the church.

You can join us just for the party and you may also help provide dishes. Appetizers, main courses, sides and desserts are all welcome!  If you wish to help prepare meals please contact [masked].  The parish center will be open at 3pm that afternoon if you need to use the kitchen.  Items can also be warmed up following mass in the ovens and microwave.

Main courses are most welcome and needed! Turkeys, ham, pasta, etc

What to expect: About 120+ members, friends and parishioners coming together to feast, celebrate and socialize. The age range will be fairly evenly split between 20's-50's. (you'll find plenty of people in your peer group)


Can I come alone?  Yes most people come on their own. Many know each other from past events and many are coming out for the first time.  (about 50/50)

How can I help?  We need people to bring food!  If you can prepare a meal, side dish, etc contact [masked]

Can I just show up for the party? yes

Cost: $15 (free for those who contribute entree's) this includes admission, food and beverages of all kinds.  Extra fund will be used for the CRC fund at Holy Trinity.


What if I am not a member of Holy Trinity Parish? Not a problem 50% of those attending will be coming from all over the tri state.

• Review the Script

• Like NYC Screenwriters at Facebook.com/NYCScreenwriters


• Follow @Scriptfeed on Twitter

To Do 

• Download the SCRIPT from our "FILES" section the week before our meeting. Read it and come prepared to give your constructive commentary.

• Members who bring written reviews go first. :)

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked]. 

• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

• Refunds will only be issued if an NYCSC Workshop or Event is Cancelled. A refund can also be issued if you un-RSVP up to 48 hours before the start of a workshop. The 48 hours is required so that a member who takes your place will have enough time to read the script. 


Thanks and see you soon!

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITER: Dr. Doug, Chiropractor, services mostly entertainment industry patients: The Ballet, Rockettes, agents, and actors. In the past year, he wrote (2) one­ hour pilots. A feature film. As well as season one of the forthcoming web series, "Second Coming", a dark sexual comedy, (Dec. of 2015).

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: Sound and Silence Meditation

A joint production of the Teaching Studios of Art® and Jerry's Palette Shop


The magic is back


After a year long hiatus, we are bringing back our famous Drink and Draw event. This time, it's in Manhattan, not Bushwick. Jerry's Palette Shop has generously offered to partner with us to help make this a top notch event, right in their store in Union Square. They have built the entire interior of the store on wheels, so it can be cleared wide open for a large event.


Teaching Studios Director Rob Zeller will MC, running it exactly as he did in Bushwick.


Great Model, Great tunes, and BYOB

Our model for the evening will be Melissa. One of the best in her profession, this is an evening you will not want to miss.


Figure Drawing from the live model, a mix of short poses and a long pose for those who would like a more finished drawing.

Sunday Nov 22, 2014, 7:00 PM To 10:00 PM


Where:Jerry's International Palette Shop
111 4th Ave
New York, NY 10003
Right off Union Square

Limited to 35 artists, first come, first served.
Spots go on sale at 6:45pm

We will begin with a few short poses, and then have one long pose that lasts for the rest of the night. This artistic event is for creative types who enjoy working from the live model. results.description:
We will be hosting our 2015/2016 indoor doubles tennis season at Cary Leeds Tennis Center!  (<a>Click here for directions</a>).

Each session will consist of 2 hours of competitive doubles tennis on Sunday nights from 6pm to 8pm. 


Here's what you need to know:

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE LEVEL [3.0]
The required level for this meetup is 3.0. In other words, you should understand the rules of doubles tennis and be able to serve and hit groundstrokes consistently. 

If you are a beginner that's still learning the basics, unfortunately this meetup isn't for you. For those beginners, I am working on an indoor option for you... stay tuned. 

RSVPing + FEE
The fee for our indoor meetups is $20. This fee needs to be paid upfront to solidify your RSVP.  After you RSVP, you will have 24 hours to make a payment. If the payment is not made, I will remove your RSVP to make room for someone else.

Each meetup will start with a 4-person RSVP limit. I am booking one court at a time this year. Once the first court is booked and paid for. I will open up the RSVP list for the next court. DO NOT BE DETERRED BY A WAITING LIST!

PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS
While I would prefer to use meetup's option for payment, the fees they charge would make it less cost effective for everyone involved. So, I will contact everyone individually (or through the meetup comments) to request payments via PayPal. 

My PayPal email address is [masked]. 

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
Bring your racquet + a fresh brand new can of tennis balls. 

WHAT WILL HAPPEN DURING THE MEETUP?
First, you will be assigned to a court.
There will be a 10-minute warmup.
After that, we will begin play.

RULES DURING PLAY
Standard USTA rules will apply with the following provisions:
1 Set Matches
No-AD games (this means there will be no deuce. At 40 all, whoever wins the next point takes the game.)
If the set goes to 6 all, you will play a No-AD tiebreak (first to 7 wins).

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN WE FINISH A SET?
After your set is complete, you will stay on the same court and switch partners with the other team.  I intend to have this planned out beforehand so expect an organized sets of matches for the night.

ANYMORE QUESTIONS?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.name: Indoor Sunday Night Doubles Tennis @ Cary Leeds Tennis Center [3.0 & above]

results.description: ". . . indissolubly, connected with Karma, is the law of re-birth, or of the re-incarnation of the same spiritual individuality in a long, almost interminable, series of personalities. The latter are like the various costumes and characters played by the same actor, with each of which that actor identifies himself and is identified by the public, for the space of a few hours. The inner, or real man, who personates those characters, knows the whole time that he is Hamlet for the brief space of a few acts, which represent, however, on the plane of human illusion, the whole life of Hamlet. And he knows that he was, the night before, King Lear, the transformation in his turn of the Othello of a still earlier preceding night; but the outer, visible character is supposed to be ignorant of the fact. In actual life that ignorance is, unfortunately, but too real. Nevertheless, the permanent individuality is fully aware of the fact, though, through the atrophy of the "spiritual" eye in the physical body, that knowledge is unable to impress itself on the consciousness of the false personality." - H. P. Blavatsky
results.name: Talk plus Q&A: "Reincarnation - Paths of Life"

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

Sun

November 29
December 20

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633176138</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125383<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. I hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge (2 drink or 2 item minimum as in any club its like $18) and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This shows lineup includes Host Jonathan Randall, Kerri Louise, Nick Griffin (Showtime), Greer Barnes (Chappele show, In Living Color), Dave Smith (Comedy Central), Seaton Smith (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Leonard can't make it to introduce everyone , could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and<a> by Advertise"> updatehttp://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png</a>; as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 -<a> by Advertise"> Starthttp://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png</a>;. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and<a> by Advertise"> join ushttp://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png</a>; for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
This still seems popular so I am posting it one last time for those that haven't yet gotten to go.


How signing up works: There are 5 spots for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 5 people signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 5 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. I do sign ups this way so everyone has a chance to attend events. I know I tend to post things late at night and want morning people to also get to come to events.


The Place:

Oiji, a new restaurant in Manhattan’s East Village, is creating a new category for Korean cuisine in New York City: Refined Authentic Korean. Exploring traditional flavors and dishes while utilizing modern cooking techniques and ingredients, artful plating and portion sizes, Oiji offers a Korean dining experience that is at once familiar and surprising, in a modern downtown setting. The intimate but stylish restaurant is accented with an open kitchen, reclaimed wood, exposed brick and ambient lighting with factory sash windows that open out to the bustling streets of downtown Manhattan.

4.5 stars on Yelp and a very good review from the NY Times.



RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: http://tunein.com/radio/soundbox-radio-s154205
results.name: Send us your latest house set to contribute to our weekly radio show!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
The FOREST PLAY SCHOOL MIXED AGE GROUP meets on Mondays at 12:30pm, Wednesdays at 9:30am and Fridays at 12:30pm.  You can join for just one day, two days or all three - whatever your preference.  The location is a set forest location in Mamaroneck area.  Please email me - [masked] if you'd like to join or learn more details.

The Southern Westchester Attachment Parenting (SWAP) group has openings in our Forest Play School group for children ages 2-6 (siblings are welcome). We are currently meeting on Mondays and Friday approximately noon until 4:30 at a Mamaroneck forest location and Wednesdays at 9:30.  You can join for one or more of these days - whatever works best for you.

Forest play school is a nature-based option that is held exclusively outdoors. Whatever the weather (rain, snow, cold), children are encouraged to play, explore and learn in a designated outdoor forest environment where the children and parents meet each week all year. This play school is play-based and parent supervision is meant to assist rather than lead. The structure of the group is inspired by the Forest Kindergarten program, which is very popular in other parts of the world and is gradually spreading throughout the US. Cutting-edge research is showing that direct exposure to nature is essential for healthy childhood development - physical, emotional, and spiritual.  The children are engaging in very important "work" through playing and navigating relationships in play school.

Each parent practices gentle guidance, patience and positive role modeling for all of the children while helping them navigate sometimes complex social situations.  Our goal is for each child to feel safe and respected by the mothers and their peers while at play school.  Each week the parents read a parenting article on positive/gentle parenting in order to discuss together.

The children feel at home in our forest location.  We prepare ourselves appropriately for the day's weather, practically this means layers, extra clothes, and sun/wind/rain/snow protection. The children find joy and amusement from the sticks, stones, bugs and plants around them, therefore they don't need to bring toys to play school. A spirit of open exploration and creativity permeates the group.  Each parent brings their own healthy food for their children (either lunch or snacks, depending on the family’s needs).  Most days include some songs and read-alouds.


Here is what some of the parents are saying:


“We love our time in the forest.  Being in the forest feels therapeutic for me and the kids.  The forest is our little sanctuary where time stands still.  The children feel deeply connected to the forest - they uncover the details of their forest home more and more each week and watch the seasons unfold right before their eyes.  There is something so magical about having no toys and watching them play so creatively.  This type of play is so ideal for problem solving, critical thinking and decision making. And the physical environment is so wonderful for gross and fine motor skill development- it provides so much more than a playground ever could!”
results.name: Rock Climbers - Forest Play School

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout and less of a social event due to the cooler temps and earlier sunset.  Due to the potential of hiking in the dark, the group will be limited in size. If you have attended Monday Bear Mountain hikes with me regularly, I will add you. That being said, I reserve the right to remove you if I am not familiar with you or your abilities. If the  questions are not answered, I will also remove you from the going list.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of a fast paced event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.name: Meditation in W. Harlem

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RendezVousnyc"></a>

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.


This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.


THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group


============================== 
Join our business group on Facebook 
Our main parent website is http://www.businessonashoestring.com
============================== </a>

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to <a href="http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm">http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 

Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

============================== 
This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 


Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

*This is a volunteer meetup.  We need a minimum number of participants to get this going.  Please do not sign up unless you can really commit and do not bail the last minute unless you have a real emergency.*

*Please Note:  I have a strict policy for no showing in volunteering events.  Cancelling within 24 hours from start of event will be counted as no show.  Any member who doesn't bother to inform me about no show will be switched out to wait list for any future event that has approached full capacity, and can only get in if the event is not filled after RSVP,s closed.* 

We will be volunteering for Baby Buggy on the scheduled day from 6pm to 8pm.  Baby Buggy helps families in need by providing essential clothing, gear and services. 

Baby Buggy appreciates your help on different projects including:

• Patching clothing samples

• Cleaning gear

• Sorting clothing by age & gender

• Bundling books/games according to age

• Filling donation requests.
results.how_to_find_us: Please go straight to the 8th floor.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "J'adore le French" a great success! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members!

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-)
The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président.

In these years we have organized hundreds of social events, French lessons and workshops, French concert etc...

We reached 5,000 members this summer!

Pictures from past J'adore le French:

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara
results.how_to_find_us: Lost ? Call/Text Yara 646-685-7521 or Jean-Philippe 917-796-7485
results.name: French Wine O'Clock ! Francophone/Francop­­hile Social event !

results.description:
Please note that our group and our happy hours are not for non-Asians.  

Icebreaker Game Continued Round 4: Find Your Zodiac Sign!

The icebreaker game from last month was complex and may have confused some!  This month, we bring it back to simplicity.  The game will run from 6:30 pm – 7:30 pm and the first 25 pairs to match will get free drinks!

1. Find another member with your same American zodiac sign (e.g., Virgo and Virgo, Aquarius and Aquarius) OR find another member with your same lunar zodiac animal (e.g., chicken and chicken, snake and snake);

2. Talk with the other member for 5-15 minutes (or more) and discover something interesting about one another.

Once you have completed these two easy steps, find one of the organizers (Richard Young or Tiffany Ma) and confirm your common zodiac sign or animal and the one interesting thing you discovered about your match to get your free drinks!  Available only for the first 25 pairs so come on time!

-- Our monthly happy hour is our flagship event that started it all years ago in 2005. Experience what it's all about -- come and meet fellow Asian professionals in a friendly, casual atmosphere. Relax after work and meet some new people.

Because this is a free event where you are not paying a cover or door fee, we humbly request that you please buy one drink or more to support our venue since they are turning away other business to allow us to host our event (buying alcoholic drinks/soft drinks/bottled water helps support the venue -- getting free tap/iced water does not).

First time to one of our events?  See photos from previous happy hours on Meetup or Facebook.

Hope to see you there!

Also find us on Facebook: 
https://www.facebook.com/events/1055448754500289/
results.name: November 2015 NYAPM Happy Hour

results.description:
After many requests, I am thrilled to finally announce a weekly study group of A Course in Miracles in Westchester!

A Course in Miracles is a guide to personal and spiritual transformation. It is based on the belief that we have two thoughts systems, one based on fear and separation from the Divine and another one based on love and oneness with the Divine. The Course is designed to help us become increasingly aware of the LOVE that is already present within us to let go all of the fearful thoughts and beliefs that we hold. Students of all levels are welcome. We will start with chapter I and we will study a few of the early lessons in the Workbook. Class is free, but suggested donation is $10 since both Lyna and Café 72 are lovingly donating the time and space. ABSOLUTELY no outside food or drink are allowed. We hope to see you on Monday to experience miraculous shifts from fear to love!
results.name: A Course in Miracles Weekly Study Group

venue.address_1: Address provided when you RSVP to The Tarot School at http://www.tarotschool.com, or call them at 800-804-2184.

results.description:
MONDAY NIGHTS, TAROT SALON WITH THE TAROT SCHOOL

Forest Hills, 6-9:30pm, 

includes delicious light dinner and dessert!

$20 Pre-register online or cash, check, card at the door 

RSVP REQUIRED TO THE TAROT SCHOOL because space is limited!

(also RSVP here at Meetup, please!)

THERE IS ONLY ROOM FOR 15 PEOPLE!

LOCATION PROVIDED WHEN YOU CONTACT THEM,

at[masked] or  http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html

Every week, The Tarot School in Forest Hills offers a valuable, interactive Tarot class in the home of the founders, Ruth Ann & Wald Amberstone. Intimate, playful, and loaded with great new techniques and knowledge-based Tarot details, each class gives attendees a chance to both learn and practice.

This Meetup can only hold 14 people, and is held in a private home, so:

1st ~  Click this link http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html
and RSVP to The Tarot School, to receive your email about location

2nd ~ RSVP here at Living Tarot Meetup so that others will know you are coming. More's the merrier!

I look forward to seeing you in Forest Hills 

to throw the cards,  learn lots, and make new friends!

Warmly, 

Ferol

http://www.ferolhumphrey.com
results.how_to_find_us: This event takes place near Jewel Avenue & Yellowstone Blvd in the heart of Forest Hills, in a private home.  You must contact the Amberstones  in order to attend.  800-804-2184 or Tarot@Tarotschool.com
results.name: The Tarot School's Tarot Salon, Forest Hills NY~ Different every week!

results.description:
On November 23, 2015, Tech@NYU will bring Salesforce to their Design Days workshop series. Members of their Product Team will discuss the different roles (UX/Product Designer, Product Management) available, how they interact with the Engineering team and how they fit into the overall vision of the organization.

Our guests will also be leading a fun interactive workshop where the audience tackles a rapid design challenge and give insight into how they solve real world problems at on a daily basis.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 5 spots besides myself for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 5 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 5 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. I am trying sign ups this way so everyone has a chance to attend events. I know I tend to post things late at night and want morning people to also get to come to events.


The Place:  For those who don't know Carbone it's an incredible Michelin starred Italian restaurant. A lot of celebrities eat there and it's difficult to get a reservation (hence why I could only get 6 PM the minute reservations became available). I'm very excited to be able to go back here.


This Event: I've been to Carbone and the pasta dishes were incredible (the others are fine, but not worth the money), so that's primarily what we are going to order.

We will be ordering and splitting the following:

2 Caesar salads (it's very good)

Tortellini al Ragu

Lobster Ravioli

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.**
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/open-gym

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, West Village, St Luke School, 487 Hudson St
When: Monday, 6pm
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like good times?  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

So we are the only rubber dodgeball league in the city.  And we're also the only sports league that lets people come play every week just to drop in and check it out and play without joining the league.  And hey!  That could be you.  You're a people right?  Excellent.

We're in the middle of our Fall season right now, which means there are 100 people there every single night who are on an official team and all. All of whom you can/should come play with and/or drink beers with.

Don't worry, we don't bite.  We WANT new people to come show up.  That's how we get more people involved in this ridiculously awesome silly game.

We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary! No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.

So every night, during the season before official league games is just open gym to come play laid back pickup games with the rest of us - running around, and getting sweaty .  And then you can come to the bar with us and share in all of our league discounts and drink specials and parties and all.

Good times eh?  Then maybe next season you'd want to join us for realsies on a team and all.  Or not.  But know we'll cry if you don't.  And then you'll have that on your conscience.  Either way, free to come try it out.  So unless you're a goober, you should probably come check it out, right?  You wouldn't want to be a goober would you?  Would you!?

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you!  [masked]

facebook.com/sandlotsportsnyc

www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE - 


Winner of the 2015 US Dept of Energy Solar Decathlon, The Stevens Institute of Technology's SURE HOUSE is a residential prototype of a truly sustainable and resilient home for the New Jersey shore. This student-designed and -built home uses 90% less energy than a typical New Jersey home through Passive House measures, is flood-proofed using a high-performance plastic and fiber-composite protective shell, and is fully solar powered. These measures combine to create a home which seeks to reduce its contribution to global climate change while also bracing for the effects of rising sea levels and increasingly severe storms.

Faculty and student team leaders will present the project in depth - looking at the design process and issues surrounding flood-proof, low energy homes as well as the construction sequence. The team will also offer an in-depth, behind the scenes, look at performance data collected during the 10-day competition in Irvine, CA, including the home's energy generation, energy consumption and interior comfort data. The home's performance will be evaluated re: the predictive PHPP and TRNSYS energy models as well.

The team took first place overall in the October 2015 contest, winning first place in an unprecedented 7 individual contests including Architecture, Market Appeal, Engineering, Communications, Commuting, Appliances and Home-Life.

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE - 


SPEAKERS: 

• Ed May, Faculty Project Manager, Stevens Institute SURE HOUSE,; Partner, bldgtyp, llc; CPHC Instructor, Passive House Academy

AIANY Committee on the Environment & New York Passive House

Free for AIA members and students with valid ID

results.description:
Explorations in Urban Data Science

Across the world, the Open Data movement is growing and more and more cities are releasing data to the public.  As citizens push for more openness, it is fair to ask: what can we do with all of this data to make our cities better?  In this talk, Ben will explore how he has used his blog, I Quant NY, and Data Science to make changes in the city he lives in: New York City.  From parking ticket geography, to restaurant inspection scores to subway and taxi pricing, Ben will discuss best practices for data science in the policy space, explore how story telling is an important aspect of data science and highlight the various data-driven interactions he has had with City agencies.

Along the way, Ben will point out that data science need not use complicated math.  He will show examples of the power of simple arithmetic, and show how often it is more about your curiosity and the questions you ask than the complexity of the equations you use. 

Ben Wellington is the creator of I Quant NY, a data science and policy blog that focuses on insights drawn from New York City's public data, and advocates for the expansion and improvement of that data.   His work has influenced local government policy (including changes in the way New Yorkers pay for cabs and a new button on NYC subway vending machines!).  He is a contributor to The New Yorker, and is a Visiting Assistant Professor in the City & Regional Planning program at the Pratt Institute in Brooklyn.  Ben is a Quantitative Analyst at Two Sigma and holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from New York University.


Don't you wish you could use the same machine learning models for data sets with 100 rows and 1Bn rows?

Ufora has built an automatically distributed, implicitly parallel data science engine for running large-scale machine learning applications. 

This talk will cover how the platform works, in terms of data and thread distribution, how it generates parallel processes out of single-threaded programs, and some recent developments for data scientists working in Python.

Ufora's core IP allows data scientists to leverage powerful distributing computing without being forced to engineer complex infrastructure by hand or work within constrained frameworks. This approach introduces some interesting challenges, like automatically detecting and implementing optimal data layouts for different ML models. For instance, linear regressions, logistic regressions, GBM's, and kNN all require different data layouts to perform well at scale, but architecting these layouts by hand is non-trivial and doesn't enable flexibility as datasets change and scale. 

Ronen Hilewicz (VP of Engineering) started engineering professionally at age 18 in the Israeli military, working on SIGINT systems. After the military, he worked at a Tel Aviv-based startup building browser security technology. In 2004, Ronen joined Microsoft where he worked on Windows internals before shifting his attention to online services and cloud infrastructure. Ronen led the engineering team responsible for the Windows Azure Service Bus—a cloud-based connectivity and messaging service.  He received his B.S. in Mathematics from Tel Aviv University.
results.name: Urban Data Science (B. Wellington) & ML for Optimizing Computation (R. Hilewicz)

A NOTE FROM JOHN - 

It's a Holiday week and to help Binnie get booked, I've made an arrangement with her to lower her fee.  Let's show her support and give her a warm welcome to the group.  

====================================== 

Hi All,

My name is Binnie. For my debut, I thought it would be a great idea to have a fun shoot at the Urbanspace, seasonal markets on 40th and Broadway.  Street photography style. 

I went there the other day. The lighting, atmosphere and seasons atmosphere is great. We can do like a "customer" (me) visiting these shops interacting with the vendors there, free style natural shoot. You can have fun with the lighting of lights and dark contrasting. There is also benches there to use. We can discuss together and come up with ideas. I am open to your thoughts.  I have many ideas myself. 

The Shoot:


This shoot starts at 6:30pm with few breaks in between for myself and you as well. 

Limited to three photographers that will shoot 3 rounds of 10 minute increments, with the option to use waiting photographer(s) as assistant(s). The shoot should last about 1.5 hours tops depending on how long wardrobe changes (if any) and breaks are.

PRICE:  $50 + 12 Booking

HOW TO PAY: Payment for this meetup is done through Paypal account. After you RSVP an invoice will be sent within a few hours for payment of the booking fee .  The balance of $50 in cash is due the day of the event, plus any surcharges you may have agreed to. - Please bring exact change.


=== CANCELLATIONS: Please note! - Events are not cancelled because of inclement weather. I will make the decision no less than 2 hours before the event. You will be notified by all the following means: posting on this event page; email; a text message and a call if no response is received from you.

ALWAYS Check this event page 2 hours before the event starts to be kept informed of the status.

Warm wishes ~ Binnie


A note from WCM - 

Why WorldChoiceModels?  Because we value everyone's time and efforts.  And listen to our members.  When you shoot with us, you are devoting your time to practice, experiment, explore. It's all about you!  There is no obligation for pictures to be traded, or given to the models, they don;t expect.   Time is money, and the models completely understand how valuable your time is.  I

Isn't it great knowing that when you are done with the shoot,  you're done!  No need to edit pictures to send to models.  Enjoy the shoot, enjoy experimenting and not worrying about having pictures to deliver. 

Cheers, 

The team at WCM
results.name: Binnie's Debut - Seasonal Photo Shoot at Urban Space (Garment District)

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.

For the Nov. 23rd meeting, please read Chapters 11 and 12.

Discussion points include:

-Mindfulness: perspectives from Buddhist psychology.

-What are some Buddhist communication practices?

***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle
