Tap into the healing nature of Qi and take charge of your own health and wellbeing. On Monday evenings, we explore the nature of Qi and Elixir Light Qigong through engaging exercises, mindful breath-work, meditation, and gentle movement patterns. As the main energy centers become more balanced and harmonized, so does the quality of our life. Allow this wellspring of the internal life force fill your life and your heart with vibrant joy and happiness. Elixir Light Qigong draws on ancient Buddhist and Taoist practices to help practitioners develop their body, mind, and spirit.

Also, in an ongoing effort to accommodate your feedback when planning our future Qigong classes and events, please fill out this brief survey – simply follow the link below. Each of your votes adds up so make sure we make yours count too!

Click Here for Class Request Survey


Thank you! I look forward to seeing you in class!

-Dan

For more than 40 years, people have flocked to GAAMC on the Monday before Thanksgiving Day. Why? Because the food is to die for, but the fellowship will make you come alive!

Each year Board members volunteer to roast turkeys, gravy, and a variety of stuffing recipes. This year, we will also be adding a ham to the banquet table. We also supply all the tableware and the standard menu of teas, coffee, soda, and sometimes juice. This potluck feast relies on you to bring your favorite (to eat, cook or buy) side dish, dessert or non-alcoholic beverage item...only about 6 to 8 servings. Doors will open at 6:30 pm, as they do every week. When you arrive, please bring your donations to the kitchen, and let us know if they need any special prep.

Here is the partial menu, that which people have shared with us:

Roasted Turkey (40 Lbs, so come hungry)

Sherri's Holiday Ham

Herb Stuffing

Apple Stuffing

Homemade Gravy

Cranberry Compote

Homemade Cranberry/Pear Relish

Bourbon Sweet Potatoes

Green Bean & Mushroom Casserole

Roasted Brussels Sprouts

Cream Cheese Stuffed Celery

Tossed Salad

Baked Apples

Cheesecake


If you are clueless about how you may participate in this potluck.  Remember, keep it simple, we only ask for 6-8 servings.  Here are a few suggestions:  Apple Cider, Fresh Fruit, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Beets, Carrots, Spinach, Pearl Onions, Dinner Rolls or Bread & Butter, Brownies, Olive and/or Pickle Assortment, covered dishes (Glad or Ziploc) for people to take home leftovers.  


We will be hosting Open Talk in the Library from 7:00 until 8:00, while the Terrace Room and Dining Room are getting setup. We will begin serving dinner at 8:00 PM. In addition to your food contribution, we ask that members donate $5 at the front door, and we ask non-members to donate $7. Of course, if you are unable to pay, you are will welcome. No one gets turned away from GAAMC.

results.description:
Do you like Javascript? Would you like to learn more about hardware and robotics? Come join us on Monday, November 23rd for a nodebots workshop. All skill levels welcome! All hardware supplies provided.


Just install node, johnny-five library and arduino IDE beforehand. Click here for instructions.

6:30 - 7:00PM: Check-in, eat, mingle

7:00PM: Workshop


What

Light installations for DIY sensors and Twitter

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/q0Q2sQ77N1KQh6QUuuS6ygOn56s7PtbwvjGKXwglMdifhfMhwjiTSvT41MMZc_sSvlz3w463p3OM3yYO1VcIFmMLOoXoD3k8ul4sTN8KE6seroGm5XTDFymWOj69-_wyGVlMUZo


We will be making a project in three stages. Each stage advances in difficulty so there is something for the novice as well as the more advanced.


Stage One: Use an Arduino to build an LED light that will change its color by sending a tweet!

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/SyEGFvpL7VzCngyxi8LjajDjXdT4OXA3vdnZuj_Tzk_zKYm54iLa2F_hZzvB_iIo1oQAKd4lC9BihPbQY2_NXOANEkjKbjZOeJl-0OxJbP5ziousCxWAReB5X4B_e4AgH9YGtNc


Stage Two: Use a sensor of your choice to gather some data. For example, a moisture sensor that will report when water levels in a plant are getting dangerously low.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/nBRhupgoA2RDo3BMEpe5bD8xSqV0hpuDTkQvUuldCMDctv_hNG2vmL2aTtoHxzxlmQLwvERYqsuymKe38-trHQsbbeYVS0pa6d9LfRVRsiBN9K6TvX3EbRhmdcJE-_LvtL6SU-w


Stage Three: Combine stage one and stage two to create an alert system that changes the LED color when a critical data metric has occurred. For example, have the LED turn green when moisture level is low and the plant needs to be watered. Use javascript/html to make a basic webapp that illustrates this data on your localhost.


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/Mx-qF-ja3SfhbOauCvSH-_isGdvenLSSWtDmCbc_rshVCVznxC4RkIiXVQ-H0Gkcue9XlxjsXUmvyc1_bYFW3IBn-RXh7ehy9PQlpwY_phNC3e6-TqCsNslIhMI3aJ3IENxkUj8

Who

The workshop will be primarily run by the following team:

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Kr250ig04G96U2XDymUgEfsiaBtAjZNTchLyFDEgnWnSy57Z6oZLMvbe-fEPxAp1AjPjynnaRy8oHZ7aUlzT0NKFTycwQzxQKVItY-W46UfKWvINGE5r_qauqig9t37rnnBy510

Stefania Druga, founder of HacKIDemia, an organization that designs robotics and maker workshops for kids all over the world. You may have already met her at some of her hardware workshops for Women Who Code or running around at other hackathons. She knows hardware and workshops-- so come out to learn from an expert! We will also have some javascript gurus in house to help with node.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/jfsivekVijdvpu8WkNJkKMEvScZAHtYIsyQ4eaAh9_PIip5UByJurdOGoGMAQiho-uc__ySI8PuqZ3TQ1c9WgWT4mFFObfR7Tc_aJgRTX_FJ-oGMQlN7SeUhNC9KSb7conXhJhU

Sara Tankard- self-taught Java programmer with about 1-2 years of professional experience. She recently dumped Java for her new love Javascript and now works as a front-end developer for The Lathe.

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/2ofr77y5MIeqoyE-LbVnSF1g5k59S0wr2hC_aS4_UHM7v5mhVmZrNwd39a0nNz2HkdQu6Thbi8PUDORgsFFnFcje6iexr8Mwy476Vc3GhBstmwH6HNwCg-txDxdw21LqsdVCpBU


Divy Tolia - CS student, extremely curious and pro-active member of Node School community, Divy went from student to mentor within a year and is planning to teach Security and CS in the future.  


Host:

NYU Production Lab is generously offering space for this workshop.


The NYU Production Lab is a film incubator for the entire NYU Community. They connect students to each other and the entertainment industry to launch creative careers. The Lab encourages interdisciplinary collaboration, provides mentorship, and financially supports the production of cinematic works for a global audience.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Master of the Rose Cross: a Collection of Essays By and About Harvey Spencer Lewis

The topic for this week's discussion is War, A Condition of the Mind.

You can download the e-book free here!

About the Book

Harvey Spencer Lewis was born in New Jersey on November 25, 1883, of Welsh heritage and Methodist parents. He received an excellent education and a fine upbringing. From a very early age, he underwent mystical experiences which already indicated his exceptional destiny. For several years, he was the president of the New York Institute for Psychical Research, and was considered an authority in this field. In 1909, he made contact with the European leaders of the Rosicrucian Order. Having given proof of his integrity and of his knowledge in philosophical and esoteric matters, he was initiated in Toulouse, where he officially received the mission of reactivating the Order in America. Despite encountering numerous obstacles and difficulties, he carried out his mission well, and in conformity with the instructions that were given him by the Rosicrucians of France, he began to put into writing the Rosicrucian teachings. In order to demonstrate the traditional and authentic foundations of the Order, he made it known under the name, "The Ancient and Mystical Order of the Rose Cross." In 1915 he was named Imperator, that is, the international leader. After having dedicated his entire life to the service of the Order, Harvey Spencer Lewis passed through transition on August 2, 1939.

This work, which is dedicated to him, is presented so that you can discover his thoughts through his essays. Though written in the past century, their message is always fresh. They demonstrate the modern spirit and avant-garde nature of this great philosopher and humanist.

All are Welcome!
results.name: COSI -Master of the Rose Cross: War, A Condition of the Mind

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

results.description:
Two Amazing Talks for our November event!

Talk 1:

Amanda Cheung 

Talk Title: Responsible Data Visualization


Talk Description: 

Many of us are visual learners. Charts and graphs display data in ways that benefit retention and comprehension. How can we build graphic representations of information that creates a better experience for our users? What are things we should worry about when designing and implementing data visualizations in our web applications? These graphs are innately visual, but it's our responsibility to make them accessible as well. In this talk, Amanda takes a look at how we as designers and developers can help our users understand our graphs better, easier and faster.


Bio:

 Amanda is the lead UX developer at DockYard, a design-driven software consultancy based out of Boston, MA. She comes from a visual background having graduated with a BFA in painting, but another part of her brain fell in love with CSS. Finding better user experience solutions by balancing designers' and developers' priorities fascinates her. She is always trying to improve the designer-developer relationship. Passionate about accessibility and CSS architecture, Amanda is also a co-organizer of the Boston CSS MeetUp and a teacher for Girl Develop It.

 Talk 2:

Karl Sluis

Talk Title: What I Wish I Knew Two Years Ago: A Designer's Guide to D3

Talk Description:

Let's face it — D3 is as powerful as it is arcane. D3 presents a steep learning curve, especially to those who are learning JavaScript as they go — like myself, a product designer by trade, an enthusiast for visualizations, and a thoroughly amateur programmer. In this talk, I'll share kernels of wisdom I've learned over the past few years, both principles and particulars. I'll discuss process, code conventions, and a few basic patterns ready to copy-paste into your own D3 project.

Bio:

As Senior Product Designer at Pandora’s Next Big Sound, Karl Sluis strives to unlock the unlimited power of music for musicians. His focus is on providing insights, tools, and data for all music makers, from small, independent artists, to epic international acts. 
Prior to joining Pandora, Karl served as an Interactive Designer at the Economist Intelligence Unit with an emphasis on data visualization. Karl has a deep passion for translating complex, rich information into friendly, usable forms.
results.name: November 2015  D3.js Meetup

results.description:
Next poll winner: The Invention of Wings by Sue Monk Kidd:

"Hetty 'Handful' Grimke, an urban slave in early nineteenth century Charleston, yearns for life beyond the suffocating walls that enclose her within the wealthy Grimke household. The Grimke’s daughter, Sarah, has known from an early age she is meant to do something large in the world, but she is hemmed in by the limits imposed on women.


Kidd’s sweeping novel is set in motion on Sarah’s eleventh birthday, when she is given ownership of ten year old Handful, who is to be her handmaid. We follow their remarkable journeys over the next thirty five years, as both strive for a life of their own, dramatically shaping each other’s destinies and forming a complex relationship marked by guilt, defiance, estrangement and the uneasy ways of love.


As the stories build to a riveting climax, Handful will endure loss and sorrow, finding courage and a sense of self in the process. Sarah will experience crushed hopes, betrayal, unrequited love, and ostracism before leaving Charleston to find her place alongside her fearless younger sister, Angelina, as one of the early pioneers in the abolition and women’s rights movements."

(Scheduling this one a little early so it's not immediately after Thanksgiving weekend, just in case people are out of town or something.)
results.name: November Meetup -- The Invention of Wings

Presentation Title: Deploying Symfony applications with Capifony

It should not be difficult, scary or time consuming to deploy your application. The key is automation and covering the important steps in your deploy process. This talk will be on general aspects of deployment and show how we can create a good and automated deploy process for Symfony applications using Capifony.


Presenter: Niklas Modess
PHP developer and consultant from Stockholm, Sweden. Currently a digital nomad living somewhere in the world. Blogger at modess.io, open source contributor, organizer of meetup group Laravel Stockholm and author of the book "Deploying PHP Applications".


"THERE WILL BE GEEKAWAYS TO THOSE IN ATTENDANCE!"
results.name: November Monthly Meetup w/Niklas Modess

results.description:
From Goodreads:

RUDIN (1856) by Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev [masked]) tells the story of a character typical to Turgenev -- a "superfluous" man, weak of will, brimming with indecisive frustration -- and yet tormented by ideals. Rudin is made impotent by the dissonance of honoring the older generations while at the same time embracing the new bold epoch of pre-revolutionary Russia. The theme of melancholic powerless men coupled with vital idealistic women is prevalent in Turgenev's work, and it would be hard to find a clearer study of the type than RUDIN.
results.name: Read Rudin by Ivan Turgenev

results.description:
Nerd TV brings the CFI community together for an evening of drinks and - well - nerdy television. A la "Science Fiction Theater," come ready to watch, critique, debate, shout at the screen and generally nerd-out over your favorite episodes of Twilight Zone, Doctor Who, Firefly, and many more!

Center For Inquiry NYC and Sunday Assembly NYC present Bad Movie Night!

Since the time of silent film, some masterpieces of the cinematographic art have been produced. They inspire, they motivate, they make us laugh and sometimes cry.

Then, there are the duds. Movies so terrible they enter a hall of fame all their own. Plots more full of holes than a cheese grater, acting more appropriate to a grade school play than a feature film and special effects so bad they’re good.

Join Center For Inquiry NYC & Sunday Assembly NYC at Stone Creek Bar & Lounge, on Tuesday, November 17 at 7pm for a screening of Robinson Crusoe on Mars. Come prepared to eat, drink, laugh and talk among friends during the movie (it’s encouraged!).

This film from 1964 is the original "The Martian," and it was claimed to be "Scientifically Authentic." We'll have all kinds of fun with this one.

Notes:  Everyone is welcome to attend. You don't have to have ever been to any other Sunday Assembly or Center For Inquiry events to participate. Also, while there is no admission fee, everyone is asked to order food or drinks to make it worthwhile for Stone Creek. See you there!
results.name: Nerd TV / Bad Movie Night: Robinson Crusoe on Mars

results.description:
Dear Friends & Troublemakers!

Let's step into our greatest adventure and live in the fullness of who we truly are - together! Let's release that which no longer serves us and liberate our true and greatest selves - open, vulnerable, infinite, loving and free!! Let's lean into our edges and our vulnerability.  Face our fears and leap into the unknown of our greatest yet to be!!! Let's play in the field of Great Spirit!!

Join us in a powerful and joyous group healing process that will allow you to release internal barriers to happiness, love, empowerment, liberation, joy, success and abundance with ease, grace, fun and laughter! Permanent positive change, expansion and growth occur as layers of repressed pain, fear, limiting beliefs, unhealthy behavior patterns and trauma are released from the body, mind and emotions in a process that combines elements of traditional counseling with a sacred transmission of the divine healing energy of Spirit - to release in one session that which takes years to heal in traditional therapeutic modalities. This all happens in a fun, loving, safe, supportive and completely confidential community setting that we will be recreating every other Monday.    

Our work with our teachers Don and Jen Hanson http://www.donhanson.com/ has catalyzed truly momentous growth and transformation in our lives, and we feel blessed and grateful to now be certified to share this truly miraculous and amazing, love and light-filled healing journey with all who are interested in being liberated from that which holds them back in order to be all that it is their sacred destiny to be. We are relatable, real world folks who have discovered something that has so transformed our lives, for which we are so grateful, that we want to pass this on to as many people as possible. In keeping with the great mystical traditions, TCM opens hearts and minds, teaches tools, and builds internal structure that allow each participant to cultivate and build their own relationship with Spirit and Sacred Energy, and far from creating any dependency on us or the process, liberates all to deepen and follow the calling of their own unique relationship to Spirit.  
With Love,Marc Anthony

Marc Anthony Chiaramonte is a Certified TCM facilitator who has been trained by Don and Jen Hanson for almost a decade. He has been facilitating TCM groups in New York, Florida and Connecticut. Early on Marc Anthony devoted his life to the journey of self discovery and personal growth. Working with the Spirit and Divine Intelligence of the Universe he helps unlock and transform old beliefs, behavior patterns and resistance to allow a deeper connection with the Divine.  

In his work Marc Anthony also brings various modalities such as Tantra, Sacred Sexuality, Psychodrama, Bodywork and Energy Healing.  He is a successful businessman and owns a Contracting and Management Company. He is also a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. Marc Anthony lives in New York City and New Jersey and is available for private healing sessions with individuals and couples.

Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

results.description:
iPhone Artistry with Dan Burkholder Workshop, Mon, Nov 23, 2015, 7 PM! 

Join us tonight at Park West Camera Club's meeting with guest speaker Dan Burkholder,  one of the first photographic artists to embrace digital technology in the early 1990s. True to his love of the traditional photograph, Dan uses digital technology to build images that still look and feel like real photographs, not like something from a graphic designer’s portfolio. Melding his unique vision with mastery of both the wet and digital darkrooms, his platinum prints are now included in many museum and private collections. Then, again, when the smartphone became of age, Dan was first on the scene boldly going where no photographer had gone before—iPhoneography! Dan has taught classes and workshops at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, the lnternational Center of Photography in New York, the University of Texas at San Antonio, the Museum of Photographic Arts in San Diego, and others. 

Be sure to see more of Dan’s imagery on his website:           http://www.danburkholder.com/


Editor's Note: I've been following Dan's activities since I bought his Making Digital Negatives book in the '90's which showed how to make and use negatives with an Epson inkjet printer for conventional and alternative darkroom printing.  He has updated the techniques for today's software and procedures.  A while back he and his wife presented their wonderful HDR prints of the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina in Louisiana.  "The Next Phase: iPhone Photographs" was exhibited at Soho Gallery in 2010 where he states:  “Photographing and stylizing images with the iPhone is one of the purest photographic phenomenon I’ve experienced during more than four decades of using a camera. With no gap between the moment of capture and time of enhancement, I find my emotional reaction to the subject becomes an integral part of the final image, in a way that’s much more honest and fluid than waiting to return to the computer or darkroom.”

There is no charge for this event.  RSVP at right.

results.name: WORKSHOP - iPHONE ARTISTRY DAN BURKHOLDER Monday, Nov 23, 2015, 7 PM!

Hello Artists of New York. La Luz is now hosting a Figure Drawing Class. Join us as we draw from a live model with optional assistance from a figure drawing instructor. What to expect?

-Series of short poses (BYOB)
-Bring drawing/painting supplies.
-Enrollment subject to availability. This class is first come first serve, so you will need to arrive early to be guaranteed a seat.

Participants agree to the following during Figure Drawing Session:
-Appointed monitors reserve the right to refuse drawing to anyone not following the guidelines below.
-No electronics with cameras, and all phones silenced throughout the figure drawing session.
-Keep talking to a minimum during drawing sessions.
-Feel free to bring a modest amount of beverages to share.
-Clean up after yourself. Respect the studio space and artwork.
-Do not walk on the photo sic wall.

Refund & Cancellation Policy

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 4,000 words or 15 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 4 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/_NUfPa242THywRP7qmU3dzQpu7EBCEkEc5JBlLikR_ehN1p7aqmo3Q8cmE1a4Yi3dtr9fesYGFIth_iGuvcaQZLYW2s_Oe1NYE7IoHV0mq3wWXWBvzAj2V0YMwSTA7Hc1NsQ8M1C

Join us on Monday, November 23rd from 7:00PM to 9:00PM for Meditation 101: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, with meditation trainer and nonprofit professional Jenn Lishansky.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCMeditationNov23</a>

===========================================

Meditation has become extremely popular among the most successful people in the world and rightly so: more and more scientific research shows that meditation can greatly improve the health of our mind and body. Regular meditation can help us let go of distracting thoughts that cloud our minds, expand awareness of ourselves, others, and the world as well as reduce stress, increase focus, and improve our abilities to be creative.

With just a few minutes a day, you can begin experiencing the benefits of meditation including:

• Improved mental clarity and focus

• A greater feeling of presence, positivity, and compassion

• Higher energy levels and better sleep

• Increased creativity and ability to manage change

• Greater sense of balance in life and work

In Meditation 101: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, you will learn a diverse set of meditation techniques that will allow you to access a state of stillness, self-awareness, and sense of calm. You will learn how to prepare your body for meditation and be guided through a series of techniques that will build a foundation for establishing your own regular meditation practice. After each technique, there will be time to reflect about your experience in order to gain a personal awareness about methods that can be applied on an on-going basis to reduce stress, increase tranquility, and inspire rejuvenation.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

• A diverse set of meditation techniques for creating stillness in the mind

• How to use meditation to increase focus, self-awareness, and creativity

• Strategies for developing a space of calm to allow ideas hiding in the depths of your mind to bubble to the surface

• Tips for carrying forward a regular meditation practice

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR  

Professionals, entrepreneurs, and anyone looking to reduce stress, increase focus and creativity, and experience more tranquility in their lives.

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Jenn was lucky enough to be introduced to meditation as a child and has been practicing for over 17 years. As an early adolescent, Jenn began teaching monthly meditation courses for young children in Boston, and for the past 6 years has led meditation retreats for children, teens, families, and adults throughout the East Coast and Midwest. Jenn’s regular meditation practice allows her to manage and enjoy her busy travel and work schedule as well as the rush of New York City living. By day, Jenn manages East Coast and Midwest Chapters at <a href="http://www.buildon.org/">buildOn, an education and service-based nonprofit that runs after school community service programs in low-resource communities and builds schools in remote communities around the globe. Previously, she worked at Seeds of Peace as their External Relations Manager where she managed online fundraising and communications, led a vast volunteer network of young professionals in New York City, and organized an international walkathon call Bridges to Peace. She also managed the Peace Market, a 1500+ event that raised over $300,000 annually. Throughout her nonprofit career and volunteer work, she has also developed curricula and lesson plans for teaching meditation, human rights, women’s empowerment, civic engagement, literacy, and leadership.

You can learn more about BuildOn here and Jenn’s background here.

SPACE PARTNER

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg

results.description:
Lauren Juliff, author of the blog, Never Ending Footsteps, is the world's unluckiest traveler. Join Wanderful NYC as we discuss her travel mishaps (and our own!) over 2-for-1 drinks.

About "How Not to Travel the World"

I had no life experience, zero common sense and had never eaten rice. I suffered from debilitating anxiety, was battling an eating disorder and had just had my heart broken. I hoped by leaving to travel the world I would be able to heal myself.

Instead, Lauren's travels were full of bad luck and near-death experiences. Over the space of a year, she was scammed and assaulted, lost teeth and swallowed a cockroach. She fell into leech-infested rice paddies, was caught up in a tsunami, her motorbike's brakes failed and she experienced a very unhappy ending during a massage in Thailand. It was just when Lauren was about to give up on travel that she stumbled across a handsome New Zealander with a love of challenges...

Support Wanderful by purchasing the book from Amazon here: http://amzn.com/B0116TQDG8
results.name: NYC #WanderfulReads: "How Not to Travel the World" by Lauren Juliff

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be on the infield near the sand pit
results.name: East River Park Track Workout (Manhattan)

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/xrX2QSLWBm24Sd_DRHaPg6giBLFo-QNPpz1ggFvzZpxEDDbrJNUnHhMztuaDrCdt2pW85or5RYzpyRbnMXm5LuQ-q3CS-Ix-AOhd8DdRTD3wJFyQ5iKaWpPyw4cudRCTSs2maxy4

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Monday, November 23rd for Managing for Impact: Building Foundational Skills for 21st Century Management (learn more about Marcos here).

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCmgmtNov23

===========================================

We are all managers. Even if “manager” is not in your job title, whenever you enter into an organization you need to work with your teammates to get things accomplished. This requires you to know how to effectively manage yourself, your work, and other people.

Management is the most fundamental skill set not only to the success of any organization, but also to the success of your career. Yet, the vast majority of employees rarely have any type of formal management training to prepare them for such a vital role. To compound this problem, what it means to be a manager in the 21st century is dramatically changing with the typical boss-subordinate management style proving to be inefficient and destructive to organizational culture. Employees are also seeking greater meaning, purpose, and responsibility at work, requiring a shift in management that is no longer based on command and control but one of collaboration and a distribution of power.

In Managing for Impact: Building Foundational Skills for 21st Century Management you will begin developing the foundation from which all other management skills are built. This course will provide managers at all levels - from experienced managers to new, recent, or aspiring ones - with the fundamental mindsets and skills for unlocking human and social capital within your organization. Managing for Impact will show you how to empower employees at all levels to work productively, and communicate effectively, share ideas, make decisions, and build innovative products and services that positively impact the lives of people around the world.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCmgmtNov23

===========================================


**SPACE IS LIMITED**

*Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp*


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

• Fully understand the purpose of management and how it is the foundation for building effective organizations

• Develop core mindsets and skills for becoming a great manager

• Understand why management is shifting in the 21st century and what you can do to adapt your management style to fit these changes

• Learn how to effectively build new communication channels with teammates as well as systems for giving and receiving feedback

• Learn 3 principles that you can begin implementing tomorrow to improve your management style and relationships at work


WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• New or recent managers looking to build a foundation for becoming a great manager and leader

• Experienced managers and executives wanting to understand workforce trends and how management is changing in the 21st century

• Aspiring managers looking to better understand how to get work done through collaborating with others

• Entrepreneurs wanting to learn foundational skills for managing people and building a positive work culture


INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/a2zd0ebdmzH4CONWpIiTyKuVUndmw3VL-3Wd73Fv-ixZlDhQH60b-TSCNdqMZQOHwQX1OTiB25OcX8LF3lwtQPqz-aes9kZH803RK-A7wFOIz0dhH2ypaqNqjqWX5rYGSFPnRf5U

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.  


SPACE PARTNER  

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/0zHinWitS1FMaZjob0szMEbSylXIBfyHvRh_qqcohki9fcCb4OBk7ANzN2w5q_RfwGei42LbLD16cAyGWXd4a-Vag1X-4iRkOkW7xcScbVt1j_0fS91UzU-9oUzjjOR0H-rk2TnO

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

results.description:
Join us for an advance screening of CREED 

For free ticket information and entry PLEASE READ IN FULL THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW.

SYNOPSIS: 

Adonis Johnson (Michael B. Jordan) never knew his famous father, boxing champion Apollo Creed, who died before Adonis was born. However, boxing is in his blood, so he seeks out Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) and asks the retired champ to be his trainer. Rocky sees much of Apollo in Adonis, and agrees to mentor him, even as he battles an opponent deadlier than any in the ring. With Rocky's help, Adonis soon gets a title shot, but whether he has the true heart of a fighter remains to be seen.

CREED is in theaters Wednesday, November 25.

Rated PG-13.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uv554B7YHk4

Come out and enjoy a movie on us!

FOLLOW THESE INSTRUCTIONS FOR YOUR FREE PASSES

★Click on the link below.

★Sign up 

★If tickets are still available, you will receive an email confirmation. PRINT OUT YOUR TICKET CONFIRMATION - That means the confirmation you get from the movie ticketing site. (In the past some of our members mistakenly brought the MeetUp confirmation instead). Don’t think you can show it on your phone, you must print it out. 

"bring with them the printed pass that they download from WB Tickets (link below, while supplies last). Talent will be in attendance and all pertinent details (dress code, arrival, etc.) will be on the ticket under SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS." 

★Let us know in the Comment section below if when you receive a confirmation email. (Also, feel free to ask questions if you are encountering obstacles.)

  ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦ Important, please keep reading ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

Suggested arrival time is between 1 hour early. You will need to get in line with all other people trying to get into the free movie. The movie begins at 8. This is first come, first serve. If you show up too late, you may not get in. You also want to come early if you come with someone to make sure that you can sit together.

DO NOT SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO ATTEND OR YOU THINK SOMETHING WILL COME UP. The promo company receives the names of all who sign up and can see who does not use their ticket. Your no-show can affect future free movie offers and we don’t want to mess that up!

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

⍟ MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL ADDRESS FOR UPDATES.  

⍟ RSVPing here on MeetUp alone does not get you a movie pass. Follow the above instructions for your tickets. 

⍟ Security will require ID. 

⍟ AGAIN, MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL FOR UPDATES! 

Download tickets at the link below while supplies last.

WB Ticket Link: http://www.wbtickets.com/XMtOF35620

Ticket does not guarantee admission. Seating is limited and based on a first-come, first-serve basis. Arrive early. Latecomers will not be admitted.

results.description:
The blockbuster Hunger Games franchise has taken audiences by storm around the world, grossing more than $2.2 billion at the global box office. The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 2 now brings the franchise to its powerful final chapter in which Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence) realizes the stakes are no longer just for survival – they are for the future.

Synopsis: With the nation of Panem in a full scale war, Katniss confronts President Snow (Donald Sutherland) in the final showdown. Teamed with a group of her closest friends – including Gale (Liam Hemsworth), Finnick (Sam Claflin) and Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) – Katniss goes off on a mission with the unit from District 13 as they risk their lives to liberate the citizens of Panem, and stage an assassination attempt on President Snow who has become increasingly obsessed with destroying her. The mortal traps, enemies, and moral choices that await Katniss will challenge her more than any arena she faced in The Hunger Games.

The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 2 is directed by Francis Lawrence from a screenplay by Peter Craig and Danny Strong and features an acclaimed cast including Academy Award-winner Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Liam Hemsworth, Woody Harrelson, Elizabeth Banks, Academy Award-winner Philip Seymour Hoffman, Jeffrey Wright, Willow Shields, Sam Claflin, Jena Malone with Stanley Tucci and Donald Sutherland reprising their original roles from The Hunger Games and The Hunger Games: Catching Fire. The impressive lineup is joined by The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1 co-stars Academy Award-winner Julianne Moore, Mahershala Ali, Natalie Dormer, Wes Chatham, Elden Henson and Evan Ross.

60 Second TV Commercial:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NMZ9BcG7lZ8

Official Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-0wdVrC4OM4

When and Where we are meeting:


Date: Monday, November 23, 2015

Time: Please arrive at 7:15pm for the 7:45pm screening. We'll wait directly in front of the movie theater till 7:30pm, and then go inside to get our seats. Don't be late! Look for me, I will be holding a "MEETUP" sign outside, directly in front of the theater.


Location: AMC Empire 25

234 W 42nd St (between 7th Ave & 8th Ave)
New York, NY


Please purchase your ticket (for the 7:45pm screening) in advance at the link below. (Ticket price: $15.49 + $1.35 Fandango charge):


https://tickets.fandango.com/transaction/ticketing/express/ticketboxoffice.aspx?row_count=104113157&tid=AAORE

This screening will likely sell out, so an advance purchase is highly, highly recommended.

Where to Meet: Our Meetup group will be meeting directly in front of the theater at 7:15pm. I will be holding a "MEETUP" sign in front of the theater. At 7:30pm we will all go inside the theater and get seats together for the 7:45pm showing. Don't be late!

Optional dinner plans: After the movie, some might want to go out to an informal vegan dinner. You are more than welcome to join us if you wish to do so. Depending on how many people are having dinner and what people's preferences are, I have two places in mind: 1. Maoz Vegetarian (falafel and fries) 8th Ave. bet 43/44, 2. Two Boots Pizza (including vegan pizza) 9th Ave. bet 44/45.

I hope you are all as excited as me to see how the franchise completes itself next month. Looking forward to seeing Fall's most anticipated movie (in my opinion).

Mohini

results.description:
How can we take our lives to higher ground and become happier and more fulfilled? We are all in this world together. Each is coming from a different place, with different expectations and goals, but one thing is common to us all: we all want to be happy. We have already tried all kinds of things, many of which didn’t work.

So how we can achieve true and lasting happiness? Well, there is a method to attaining happiness, and through it we can reach a point where the fulfilment will not extinguish the desire.

We will try together to experience it in the most practical way, with the help of the wisdom of Kabbalah, which teaches us the method of how you can reach satisfaction that never turns off. The happiness that fulfills all my desires, all the voids in me, full of power, and also gives me confidence that it will never end, and nothing can harm me.

Join us for an evening of exploration, Q&A, and lively workshops with other like-minded seekers guided by experienced Kabbalah instructors.
results.name: Kabbalah & the Secret to Happiness

results.description:
Join Life Fulfillment Coach and Affirmative Thought specialist Thomas Dunleavy, CPC at this weekly meetup for open hearted minds committed to living their best life now...one word at a time!

With a new affirmation set as the theme each week, Thomas helps repurpose the group's existing beliefs and thought patterns into a realistic source for inspiration and present moment empowerment! Through the use of visualization, coaching, positive psychology and of course affirmations, community members enjoy a renewed sense of optimism, excitement, strength and self love.

AFFIRMATION MONDAYS is a safe place to heal, grow, help and learn in the collective power that comes from a group.  If you're feeling lost, confused, stagnant...work it out with the group! When you're enthused, excited, passionate and pumped...share it too! The community is here to support you where you are, just as you are!

The group meets in the home sanctuary and workshop space Esoteria EVERY MONDAY at 7:30 p.m.  RSVP to [masked] or call[masked] to confirm your attendance and reserve your seat.  $12.00 love offering.

*Esoteria is the collaborative venture between Declare Coaching's Thomas Dunleavy and Bene Mudra founder James Bene. Together they are dedicated to building a community for authentic spiritual empowerment; please join them today!

www.declarecoaching.com

www.benemudra.com

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:


Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Marcus's Novel Group

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7:30 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

 
Nov 9:  Experienced Circlers Only
Nov 16  :  Beginners 6:30,  Experienced Circlers 7:30
November 22:   Experienced Circlers Only
November 29 : Be sure to join us for the large Community Circling Night where our community comes together for a robust night of circling with multiple facilitators and amazing group presence exercises. These nights include intro for newcomers. Register here: https://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
